dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're RUNNING through a battle-zone. BODIES right and lef strewn on a street. We keep running, dodging death itself An ARROW just whizzed by us, barely missing, banging nois into what used to be a newsstand. Another arrow buzzes pa Running, desperate - hearing our own footsteps, our shall breaths and groans of fear. There's another body on a sidewalk, semi-impaled. This is a perfect Hell. It used to be Aspen - 300 years ago. Abandoned now, overg with foliage, decaying, dead. We run around a corner, our heart rate spiking -~ a KNIFE hurtling at us out of nowhere. PFFFT! It buries itself in our left arm. The pain is searing. We falter... But we have to keep running, have to get to safety. Our e darting, looking for somewhere to hide-- Old Coffee Shops, Ski Rental Shops, Yogurt shops - skelet now, covered in vegetation, their windows long since blow away. Death waiting inside all of them. Then: A SPEAR, thrown from what used to be a second-story windo We DIVE OUT of its way. It just misses us. But we've land on that wounded arm. More searing pain. We get to our feet. Please let this end. Behind us we hea VOICES YELLING: “Get him!" We don't look back. Just can't There's a corner up ahead. Safety. We reach it, turning.. .-.to find a WELL-BUILT KID of 17 awaiting us, with a SPI MACE in his arms. He swings it at us - at our head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEN - POP! - BLACKNESS, like a video feed shorting. We

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bleak Town Square in what used to be Coal Country, know now as "The Seam" - a colorless world of sagging building and cinder streets; even the trees seem gray here. Despair, poverty, hunger... And TV. A huge screen in the heart of this Town Square, where 2,000 townspeople just watched that horrific death, live and in color. Their eyes are blank, lifeless. Years of struggle and dea etched into every face - as we hear the VOICE of famed broadcaster CLAUDIUS TEMPLESMITH:

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (THRU TV)
dialogues.text: Oh, that's too bad. Sage Blanken goes down, knocked out by that Prospero boy from District Three - who certainly is handy with a mace! Once again, both Tributes from District 12 are out. But at least they got one into Day Two this year! 2,000 townsfolk, watching the bloodbath on that huge scre A GIRL darts across another overgrown street in that abandoned resort town. The long tongue of a WHIP lashes o trying to trip her. She bounds over it... +-.as we start drifting through this Town Square...

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (THRU TV, O.S.)
dialogues.text: Don't forget, friends, to VOTE for your favorite Tribute! The cost is six Florins - or eight Florins once The Games are down to the Final Four. We come upon a cluster of TOWNSFOLK, surrounding a stunne WOMAN. This is CORRINA - her face white with grief. ---because it was her son that just died on that big scre A WAIL rises out of her - pure agony. A keening shriek...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: »+.as KATNISS EVERDEEN walks past without turning. She's lean and hungry, with steel-gray eyes and a long dark bra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a fighter, robbed of her little-girl years long ago. * On her right is that huge screen, broadcasting more of th spectacle. On her left, NEIGHBORS lead a shell-shocked * Corrina away. Katniss continues through the Square. * @ ...to find her sister, PRIMROSE EVERDEEN, (11, barely on to some innocence.) Prim quietly watches the Games.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I'm gonna go catch some dinner.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Can I come?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: It's sweet that you keep asking - when you know I'm going to say no.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to teach me eventually, Katniss.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: "Eventually" is a long time from now, Prim. Look in on Mom. Prim nods. Katniss drifts out of the Town Square, onto wh was once a viable Main Street, bleak now. Behind her, 2,0 people keep watching The Games in a semi-hypnotic fog. .--except for one: PEETA MELLARK, a broad-shouldered boy 16, whose eyes, now and forever, are following Katniss -

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (THRU TV)
dialogues.text: Yet another disappointment for the folks from Coal Country and their sotted mentor, Haymitch Abernathy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAYMITCH ABERNATHY, 40, watches the broadcast from inside fishbowl. The walls around him are WINDOWS, looking out o The GAMES CENTER, Mission Control for "The Hunger Games." Huge screens. Data. Dazzling technology. Haymitch eyes it bitterly, slugs down some pale alcohol,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An untended MEADOW gives way to a large CHAIN-LINK FENCE stretches on forever. On the other side of it, FOREST. SIGNS line the fence: "No Trespassing Beyond This Point." "Violators Will Be Electrocuted." "Poaching is a Felony." eo Katniss, unimpressed, throws a stick at the fence. Not happens. She crawls under it, scooting in unharmed.  © EXT. FOREST - DAY She heads for a felled LOG, reaches into its hollow. Feel for something, then extracts it: ~ A BOW, and ARROWS, wrapped in a sheath of plastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss is a born hunter. A born climber too. With her bo and arrow slung on her back, she climbs a tall tree, navigating the branches like a monkey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She settles, 30 feet up. Great vantage-point. And there i is, below - a WILD TURKEY. Katniss draws back her bow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dead turkey has been tied to a stick, resting by Katniss's side. She's behind a ROCK, scouting her next ki Two large gray RABBITS. Maybe 30 yards from here. Katniss lines one up, draws back her bow. Tension in the string.. @ ..-when, suddenly, a HAND i: laced over mouth. Someone just come up behind her, out of nowhere. A BOY, whisperin

dialogues.speaker: GALE, ("BOY")
dialogues.text: You're good. But I'm still better. This is GALE HAWTHORNE, 17, her best friend/hunting partn Handsome, dark-haired, he loves being with her, (more tha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he'd ever admit, even to himself.) Loves teasing her. * -+-until she bites his finger, playfully. *

dialogues.speaker: GALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ow!

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: How do you do that? How do you move without making a sound?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I'm lightfooted.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Get to work. eo She gestures to the two large rabbits, drawing back he Gale draws his as well. They fire at the same time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six rabbits on a stick now, and a second Wild Turkey. Gal and Katniss sit by a stream, eating fresh-picked greens. about to eat one when she yanks it away.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: What'd you do that for?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: That's Fawn's Leaf. You wanna throw up all night?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I'd rather eat the rabbits, ya know? *

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Great. And what would we have to trade with? A lousy reality. He pushes the rest of the "meal" away.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I didn't watch this morning. Is the Blanken kid still in it? (Katniss shakes her head) @ So we're out again. Like every year.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I think the guy from 2 is gonna win. Gale draws his bow back, indulging in a juvenile fantasy:

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: One day, one of these'll be aimed at Claudius Templesmith. And another one at Seneca Crane. The last one at President Snow. No more Games.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Right, except your name's gonna be entered -- how many times? -- forty two times in the Reaping next year?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: My family needs grain and oil, Katniss. Yours too. Then, in a blur, Katniss grabs her bow, wheels around, an aims fifty feet over Gale's head: PFFFFT. Just bagged a e SQUIRREL, high up in a branch. She starts to climb towa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother. It's too... (she's already gone) High. Katniss is halfway up the tree. Gale sighs, to himself:

dialogues.speaker: GALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or we could just stay out here...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Oh. I almost forgot. (tony Capitol accent: ) Happy Hunger Games! And may the odds be--

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: --ever in your favor... She climbs, disappearing up that impossibly-tall tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head for the electric fence with their haul. Katniss spots something - bends down for it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: @ Purple berries, growing at the base of a tree. She eyes then picks a few, putting them into the pouch on her hip. Gale watches her... silent... until:

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: We could do it, ya know.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Leave the District. Stay out here, in the woods. We could make it.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Who'd take care of Prim? And my mom?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: No, I don't mean now. Obviously. I mean, when Prim got older.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Didn't really think this through - ) did you? She's trying to diffuse it. He reddens a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless you'd rather move into town and marry a coal-miner. Or a baker. Have ten kids or something.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: These are my options? (Gale's silent) And I'm never having kids. With anybody. Not in this world. But thanks. They share a look...until an odd SILENCE suddenly falls.. The birds in the forest stop singing. Nothing moves. Eeri ...Then a BLUR, racing past us in sheer terror. It's a RED-HAIRED GIRL, (her name's LAVINIA), Katniss's a but dressed differently. Running for her life now.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What was-- That fast, Lavinia is gone, racing for the fence. Katniss Gale whip around, to see what's chasing the poor kid. There's nothing back there. ..-until they hear it, from above... A HOVERCRAFT. Huge, propwash blowing treetops sideways over the fleeing Lavin Katniss and Gale hide behind a rock-shelf, watching, as t VOICE of an UNSEEN OFFICIAL booms from inside t raft:

dialogues.speaker: UNSEEN VOICE
dialogues.text: Surrender! You are to be returned to The Capitol for adjudication! Lavinia is frantic, almost at the fence... when a GIANT N drops from the hovercraft like a rock, enveloping her. She looks to Katniss and Gale, her eyes desperate. Help m Gale starts to rise - but Katniss yanks him back down.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: They'll kill you. Before Gale can reply, the net tightens, yanking Lavinia the air. And she's GONE, into the Hovercraft, abducted in mere seconds. Katniss just stares. We DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Used to be a COAL WAREHOUSE. Now it's a BLACK MARKET: car offering food, salt, coats, herbs - and all of it dicey. The feeling is hushed, dark, desperate. Gale trades with woman named GREASY SAE: some greens for a chunk of PARAFF Nearby, Katniss barters with a bread-seller named OPEQUON who is eyeing her dead rabbits, evaluating two side by si

dialogues.speaker: OPEQUON
dialogues.text: Looks narrow to me. I want that one.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: That one's spoken for. This is the one I'm trading.

dialogues.speaker: OPEQUON
dialogues.text: Looks narrow to me.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I'll give ya two for it. Katniss and Opequon turn: here's Peeta Mellark, approachi with two loaves of bread in hand. Katniss appreciates the offer. Opequon doesn't, glaring right through Peeta, as:

dialogues.speaker: OPEQUON
dialogues.text: I was offering one.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I think it's worth two. Opequon grumbles, goes. Katniss grins as Peeta hands her loaves of bread. (One of them is slightly black on top.)

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This one's a little burned, so we couldn't sell it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: What happened to your eye, Peeta? Peeta'd been trying to conceal it, but he has a SHINER...

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Oh. Just wasn't looking where I was going. She nods, hands over the rabbit. It's time to move on... +--So how come Peeta's still standing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see ya, Katniss.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: ‘Night, Peeta. Thanks. He drifts off. She goes in the opposite direction. Gale, far from here, takes note, then returns to his trading. We FOLLOW KATNISS, through this warehouse of starving cru sellers, when something catches her eye: Corrina, the woman who lost a son this morning, sitting o stool, her eyes haunted - as her husband TYGART hawks som meager-looking CHESTNUTS. Tygart is in a fog, but Corrina is catatonic. Katniss pau torn... then makes a decision. She passes by Tygart, and:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: These'll help her sleep. My mom takes ‘em. She hands over two of the PURPLE BERRIES she picked today and she's gone... before Tygart can even say thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss pulls a rickety wagon over cinder streets. A TRAI rumbles outside town, loaded with coal. On its side: "District 12 Coal - Powering the Capitol for 300 Years." There are no streetlights on - no power to feed them - bu that HUGE TV in the Town Square is on, as always... beami The Hunger Games, death as entertainment. A CROWD watches Katniss walks by without looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small, crammed in, untended. Katniss leaves her wagon in yard, where a small GOAT is tethered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dusty, unkempt. At a table sits MRS. EVERDEEN. She's 40 b looks 60, deadened by grief and fear. Katniss enters.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I'm home.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Katniss!  10. Prim runs in, hugs her older sister. The bond here is dee

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Look what I traded for. Katniss holds up TWO THREADBARE COATS she traded for toda

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Whoa! Coats!

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Yours are both so worn. Let me see if it fits. Prim throws hers on. She's swimming in it.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Perfect!

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Mom? No reply. Katniss crosses to Mrs. Everdeen. A cat, BUTTER (mashed-in face, half an ear missing) jumps in the way.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Move, Buttercup.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Be sweet with him.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Why, did he catch a mouse today? Did he do anything useful? (Buttercup hisses a bit) Another mouth to feed. She pushes Buttercup aside without much fanfare, then put the other coat across her mom's shoulders. No reaction.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: What about you, Katniss?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Mine's fine. Stand up, Mom. Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. EVERDEEN
dialogues.text: I don't like you going to The Hob. (Katniss rolls her eyes) Peacekeepers're gonna shut it down eventually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + ee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e  11. Katniss looks to Prim, who loves being in on a joke:

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Eventually is a long time from now, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: And the Peacekeepers trade there too. * Mrs. Everdeen nods blankly. It saddens Katniss and Prim.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon, Prim. Help me with supper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls share a bed in the Den. Looking down from a man is a picture of their FATHER. He had kind eyes...

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Katniss? (Katniss waits) What happens if they call you at The Reaping next year?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Why would they call me?

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: I'm not dumb, Katniss. I know that every time you take out tesserae to get us stuff it means your name's gonna be in there more times next year.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Don't worry. There'll be people with their names in there lots more times than me.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: still.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Ssshbh. Prim falls silent. But just for a second.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Katniss...?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Mmm—-hmmm.  12.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Will you sing it?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: The one Dad always sang?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: And then you'll sleep?

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: I promise. Katniss clears her throat, then:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Deep in the Meadow/Under a willow/ A bed of grass/A soft green pillow/ Lay down your head/Close your sleepy eyes/When they open again/The Sun will rise... Prim's eyes close. We DRIFT THROUGH this home... to find: Mrs. Everdeen is across the room, wide awake, listening..

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here it's safe/Here it's warm/ Daisies guard you from every harm/ Dreams are sweet/They all come true/ Here is the place where I love you. Mrs. Everdeen quietly weeps - pure dread. We GO TO BLACK: ++-over which, a SUPER: "One Year Later." Then SMASH TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERTS, in rapid fire: A COMBAT KNIFE - placed on what looks like a brass table- A SPEAR - lain carefully beside the knife. A SPIKED MACE stands against a sheer wall. Lastly, a BOW and ARROWS are hung on a hook. Someone is preparing an arena for The Hunger Games. We CUT TO:  13. EXT. FOREST —- LOCATION UNKNOWN - MORNING A pack of WILD DOGS prowls menacingly. These things are H the size of bulls. With fangs and hungry eyes. But they're being tracked - by a pair of HUNTING RIFLES, yards away. Darts are chambered into each rifle... as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SENECA CRANE, a dark genius, looks over his domain. This is Mission Control, (seen from the windows surroundi Haymitch's quarters last year.) It's NASA on steroids: hu screens, data, massive electronic coverage. On an ILLUMINATED BOARD we see 24 EMPTY SLOTS, two for ev District. Names will go here; two from District 12... Sen eyes it, then spots something that irritates him greatly: An assistant, BETTO, is virtually drawing on a monitor (i a hobby) - unaware that Seneca is in the vicinity... unti Seneca leans in and angrily deletes Betto's screen. Uh-oh

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: You're here to work, Betto. (Betto gulps) Unless you think all those Tributes are just going to kill themselves. He walks away. Betto's too shaken to blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet, somber feeling in here, like dressing for a fune Katniss steps into a worn blue dress. Prim, now 12, tucks white blouse into a skirt. Their mother opens a wooden bo

dialogues.speaker: MRS. EVERDEEN
dialogues.text: I thought you might like to wear this, Prim. She shows Prim a GOLD MOCKINGJAY PIN. Beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Why do we have to dress up for the reaping?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. EVERDEEN
dialogues.text: It's expected. (offering the pin) Take it. Dad loved mockingjays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e ee

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: What if I lose it? Mrs. Everdeen shrugs. Prim takes the pin, tries to fix it her blouse, but her trembling fingers won't co-operate. S Katniss steps in and does it for her.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: We'll pin it on tight. There. Katniss turns away - but Prim grabs her hand, urgently:

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: They can't take you. Tell me they can't take you.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Prim. We've used up all our bad luck already. The sisters study one another, then Prim turns away.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tuck in your tail, little duck. Prim's shirttail sticks out. Katniss takes care of it.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Quack.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Quack, yourself. Katniss hugs Prim tightly - letting on for the first time unnerving all this is - then kisses the top of her head.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can't be late, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Packed - by the 8,000 RESIDENTS of District 12. They fill adjacent streets too. CAMERA CREWS look down from rooftop In front of the Justice Building we find a PODIUM, three chairs, a microphone... and two large GLASS BALLS, contai thousands of slips of paper. On each slip, a name... * Katniss guides a white-with-fear Prim through the crowd. There's a grim buzz in the air, a shared tension. PEACEKEEPERS in white uniforms herd everyone along: *

dialogues.speaker: UNNAMED PEACEKEEPER
dialogues.text: All candidates stand with the others in their age group! Twelve year-olds here! Thirteens here! ++-as we realize that the only people in this Square are CHILDREN. 12 to 18. Adults stand outside the ropes. Mrs. Everdeen is one of them, staring blankly. Katniss guides Prim through. ANOTHER PEACKEEPER steps in.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: She's twelve. He tugs Prim away. She calls out to Katniss, desperately:

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: They call your name - you run, okay? *

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I'll see you at dinner. Dress casual. A reassuring smile - it helps - until Prim is led into th herd of twelve year-olds, waiting together. Katniss turns away, passing one tense teenage face after another, as: * MAYOR UNDERSEE speaks into the microphone on the podium:

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR UNDERSEE
dialogues.text: My Friends of District Twelve, in anticipation of the Seventy-Fourth Hunger Games, I welcome you to Reaping Day... Tepid applause. His speech continues, in b.g., as Katniss drifts through. Not far from here are the EIGHTTEENS, may 200 kids, trying not to look terrified. Gale is among the It's just a look between him and Katniss, but it's loaded hope it's not you." Gale smiles a thin smile. Katniss tur away, finds her place in the herd of SIXTEENS. * Plenty of posturing around her, all of it hiding terror.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR UNDERSEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This Day, like The Games themselves, provides us a chance to reflect on the costs of our violent rebellion all those years ago, and to be grateful for the kindness now shown to us by the Capitol. It’s a time for both repentance and for thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Undersee on the stage is EFFIE TRINKET, (her suit green, her hair pink.) Beside her is an empty chair... un

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: ‘Scuse me. Sorry to be late. Haymitch Abernathy stumbles on to the stage, inebriated. TV CAMERAS ZOOM IN on him... as Mayor Undersee continues:

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR UNDERSEE
dialogues.text: By law, each District is required to send one boy and one girl into the Games each year. 24 young people, fighting to the death until one emerges victorious - bringing great pride, and great material reward, to his or her District. Joining me now on stage is the only Tribute from our fair District to have ever done so. Please welcome Haymitch Abernathy. Haymitch rises drunkenly and gives the mayor an enthusias slap on the back. But when he tries to hug Effie, he ends lurching across her and slamming into the empty chair. And it all just went out LIVE, across Panem. The kids sti nervous laughter. +..as Effie, tight-lipped but professional, straightens h wig. And Mayor Undersee does his best to go on.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR UNDERSEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sure whoever's chosen today will - under Haymitch's steady guidance - represent our District well. Katniss tightens. Another look to Gale.

dialogues.speaker: MAYOR UNDERSEE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now it’s my privilege to introduce our tributes’ escort. Joining us from the Capitol, Miss Effie Trinket. One hand steadying her wig, Effie trots to the podium. Bright and bubbly, she speaks in a stilted Capitol accent

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Happy Hunger Games! And may the odds be EVER in your favor! I know you're all excited, so let’s get right to the drawing! Boys first this year! Nobody breathes. Hardened coal mining families - terrifie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the COAL-TRAIN on the elevated track a few blocks aw has come to a stop, its CONDUCTOR watching. Effie squeezes her eyes shut, sticks her hand in the ball the boys' side, and plucks a name out. CLOSE ON Katniss, jaw clenched, fingers crossed at her si

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The boy tribute from District Twelve is-- We PUSH IN on Gale, as...

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Peeta Meelark! ..-.which is when we find Peeta, just a few feet from Kat she'd somehow not noticed him before. But she turns - just in time to see his face go pale... A GROAN goes up from his PARENTS, outside the ropes. TWO PEACEKEEPERS come to collect him as he steadies himse Katniss can't meet his eye, can barely mutter:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Sorry, Peeta. Somehow he breathes out a smile, despite the horror. It surprises her. Then Peeta's gone, and:

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: I'm sure Peeta will do a wonderful job for us. Now, the ladies! Not far from here, PEETA'S MOTHER has just fainted dead a Her HUSBAND is trying to revive her. Every boy who wasn't chosen - except for Gale - is sagging with relief. -+-as Peeta mounts the stage silently. And Effie digs her hand into the GIRLS' GLASS BALL, and...

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Girl Tribute from District Twelve will be... (Katniss gulps...) Primrose Everdeen! And the world simply stops. Time itself seems to hover. Katniss freezes, replaying it in her head. Must have hear wrong. Prim too - a look of utter confusion on her face..  18.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Katniss? The Square is deathly SILENT. No one can believe what the just heard. Mrs. Everdeen staggers. Gale just stares, daz

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: (mumbled, to no one) But... her name was only in there once. And here's Prim, lost, surrounded by TWELVE YEAR-OLDS...

dialogues.speaker: PRIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Katniss? Katniss slumps backward, dumb-struck. ANOTHER GIRL steadi her. Everything's spinning. Then she sees - dimly - TWO M PEACEKEEPERS bulling their way through the 12 year-olds.. Prim's face fills the huge tv screens - a lost little gir her head swimming. The Peacekeepers begin to pull her awa And all Prim can think to do is tuck in that loose shirtt again as she's tugged through the crowd... We PUSH IN on Katniss, the world crashing around her - until:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: {top of her lungs) I volunteer! Hold it. Everything just stopped again. All eyes - even t of the cameras - now find Katniss... whose voice seems to operating on its own.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I volunteer as tribute! No one replies. On the faces of Gale, Peeta, Effie, every shock. Katniss heads for the stage, almost in a trance.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Katniss... Katniss keeps walking - all eyes on her - nearing her sis who is too dazed to reply. Can barely mutter:

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: No... Katniss walks right past her. Peeta watches from the stag  19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Katniss Everdeen. I'1l represent District Twelve.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Well, bravo! Brava! Quite a gesture! And there's nothing in the rules forbidding it, is there Haymitch? Haymitch, his drunken brain catching up, shakes his head. So Katniss keeps coming... even as Prim grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: No, Katniss! No! You can’t!

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: (pulling herself free) It's okay, Prim.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: (not letting go) You can't! I won't let you! All of it going out LIVE. Gale steps forward. His eyes me Katniss's - another loaded moment - and he does what she' begging him to do... pulling Prim away.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I've got her. The Peacekeepers lead Katniss away. Prim shrieks, crying:

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: No! Don’t take her! Don’t! Gale carries Prim off as Katniss mounts the steps.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: I bet my buttons that was your sister, wasn't it! Don’t want her to steal all the glory, do we? Let's give a big round of applause for our latest tribute! No one claps. Instead, they do something else - a gesture In unison, the people here touch the three middle fingers their left hand to their lips and then hold it out to her is a gesture of immense respect. Also a fond farewell. ©@ Katniss acknowledges it silently from the stage. Then NATIONAL ANTHEM begins to play through LOUDSPEAKERS.  20. Peeta is beside her. Gale is suddenly a world away. And s is fighting back tears as we CRANE UP... until she's just tiny dot in this Town Square...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss is escorted into an elegant room by A PAIR OF PEACEKEEPERS who retreat and stand guard at the door. She sits on a velvet couch. Then Prim and Mrs. Everdeen enter Prim runs across the room and buries her face in Katniss’ lap, awash with tears. Katniss holds her tightly. Mrs. Everdeen is outside the hug, too bereft to function.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay, Mom. You'll have the money from Prim's goat-milk. And Gale will bring you game. Mrs. Everdeen half-nods, breaking down in sobs.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Listen, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Don't go, Katniss...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: (grabs her mom) Listen to me! (Mrs. Everdeen turns) You can’t do to her what you did to me. You can't disappear on her like you did when dad died - because there won't be any me around to look out for everybody. That registered. We can see Mrs. Everdeen take it in...

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: I know. I won’t, I--

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Whatever happens, whatever you see on the screen, you have to fight through it and take care of her! Another nod. Prim clasps Katniss’s face in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: You have to take care, too. You're so fast and brave. Maybe you can win.  21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying) Maybe. Then we'd be rich as Haymitch.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: I don’t care if we’re rich. I just want you to come home. (Katniss nods) You will try, won’t you. Really, really try?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Really, really try. I swear it. Prim unlatches the MOCKINGJAY PIN from her dress and pins on Katniss with trembling hands.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Wear this. It'll be like having a piece of me with you. Katniss nods, blinks back a tear.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Prim, there're some things you're going to have to take care of now. @ The trading. That's gonna be you. (Prim's eyes go wide) You know what to pick in the forest. There are Katniss-plants by the creek; a bunch about this big is worth a loaf of bread at The Hob. Make sure you always bring back strawberries for the Mayor. He'll tell the Peacekeepers to leave you alone. But you have to check the fence with a stick EVERY time you go through it; one of these days they're gonna turn it on. Have you got all that? Prim nods, sort of. Katniss tries to lighten things:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And take care of Buttercup, okay? He's gonna be so sad without me! Prim almost smiles. Almost. Then the moment shatters:

dialogues.speaker: FIRST PEACEKEEPER
dialogues.text: , That's all you get. Let's go. it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee He moves in. The family joins in a final, desperate embra  22.

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: You're gonna keep the pin on, right? Katniss nods. Peacekeeper pulls Prim and Mrs. Everdeen aw

dialogues.speaker: PRIM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you're gonna come back?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I love you. * And they're gone. The door slams shut. Katniss stands the her arms hanging limply at her sides. Utterly alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Square is empty now. The Podium set has been struck. Everdeen, trying to be strong, leads Prim away... But Gale remains out here, alone, distraught. Staring... .-.at Katniss, barely visible through a second~story wind in the Justice Building. It's a final, wordless goodbye - until she's pulled away. We hear the sound of a TRAIN, as * oF

dialogues.speaker: EVENING
dialogues.text: Katniss sits in silence on a train doing 250 m.p.h. Out t window we just see darkness. Then a light knock on her door, and Effie Trinket's voice

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dinner's soon! Please bathe! Then Effie's gone. Katniss rises, in a fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss drifts in. Everything in here is new to her. There's no tub. Instead... a shower. Huh? She hits a knob shocked when water comes out. She literally recoils. And there's her reflection, caught in the bathroom mirror Feels like a stranger looking back at her. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: EVENING
dialogues.text: Katniss, freshly showered, sits in a dull green jumpsuit, mockingjay pin on it. Effie and Peeta are here. No Haymit  23. @ Before them is the biggest meal Katniss has ever seen: chops, carrot soup, mashed potatoes, green salad.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Eat, please. Food's always so scarce in the Arena, you want to go into The Games with some meat on your bones. Katniss and Peeta begin - awed by the quantity.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Where's our mentor?

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Haymitch is taking a nap. It's been an exhausting day. On a MUTED TV behind Effie, we see a NIGHTLY ROUND-UP of coverage from all the Reaping Ceremonies across Panem tod Twelve Districts, each selecting a lucky boy and girl... A monstrous boy from District 2, a fox-faced girl from 5, boy with a crippled foot from 10. And, most hauntingly, a 12 year-old girl from District 11 @ She has brown skin and soulful eyes. Katniss just stare Then, clips from the District 12 Reaping. Katniss herself And Prim. And Peeta... And Haymitch, stumbling on stage. Her mentor. A drunk. It's unsettling as hell...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Is he going to tell us what to--

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: I'm thrilled you two have such decent manners! The pair last year ate everything with their hands! It completely upset my digestion.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Hungry people don't think much about manners. Effie tightens. Peeta's silent - his eyes riveted on the

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: (re: news on TV) Checking out the competition, Peeta?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the Careers.  24.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I don't know what that--

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: (yes you do) The Tributes that are trained for the Games by their Districts.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: No Districts do that. Bullshit. Katniss and Peeta know it. But Effie tries:

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's just a rumor. Everyone knows District training is illegal.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Then why do the winners always come from One, Two, and Four every year?

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: The Tributes from the wealthier Districts get more Sponsors, that's all. So they get more help. There's nothing sinister about it. She just lost them, officially. More tension... as Haymit stumbles in - hammered, as usual.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: I miss supper? Tense silence. He takes a seat, sets his drink down, unfo his napkin - reflexively reaching for a bottle of white G ..-but Peeta, just as reflexively, grabs Haymitch's hand. shocks the hell out of everyone - mostly Peeta himself.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Sir, I think we'd both prefer it if you didn't have anymore to drink. You're supposed to be advising us.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Here's some advice. Don't die. He bursts out laughing. Katniss looks to Peeta.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: That's very funny. He throws Haymitch's glass to the floor, shattering it.  25.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Only not to us. Haymitch considers that for a moment, impressed, then slu Peeta_in the jaw, knocking him from his chair. Haymitch reaches for the bottle... +.-just as Katniss stabs at his hand with her knife, bare missing flesh. The knife digs itself into the table. SILE Everyone awaiting an explosion from Haymitch... until:

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Well. Did I actually get a pair of fighters this year? Katniss and Peeta weren't expecting that. Haymitch eyes h

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you hit anything with that knife besides a table? Katniss yanks the knife from the table and throws it at t far wall. It sticks between two panel-seams. Haymitch ris circles his two Tributes, studying them.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll make a deal with you two. You don't interfere with my drinking, and I'll stay sober enough to help you. Is that fair? (they nod) You'll have to do exactly as I say. About everything. Effie puts some ice in a napkin, hands it to Peeta for th BRUISE reddening his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. Let it bruise. People will think you've been mixing it up with the other Tributes before you've even entered the Arena. (Peeta sets it down) When we get to the Capitol, you'll be put in the hands of stylists who'll prepare you for your presentation. Their work is vital.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Right. 'Cause it's a beauty contest.  26.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Yes. It is. And the people who figure that out tend to be the ones who survive. Are you through now? That shut Katniss up. Haymitch looks right through her.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The best-looking tributes get the Most sponsors. And sponsors are my only means of helping you once you're in The Arena. Understood? .--which is when Katniss sees something out the window - landmark, recognizeable to us... It's Chicago. Or what used to be Chicago. Across Lake Michigan we see t skeleton of a city. Decayed, lifeless. An empty ghost tow Haymitch approaches the wall, eyes the knife Katniss thre

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this where you were aiming?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: More or less.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Good. Eat. Katniss picks up a lamb chop with her hands, devours a bi then wipes her hands on the tablecloth. Effie sighs. CUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A COAL TRAIN, in a grimy part of The Seam. We PUSH IN, to look at its payload, a bed of BLACK COAL... ..-with a STOWAWAY atop it - Gale. He throws a look at: * +..Prim, who stands at the fence of the marshalling yard. nods, "Go." He nods back, then ducks out of sight. * The train pulls out of the yard, into dark night. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss tries to hide her awe, but it's an effort - becau we've just pulled into The Capitol - and it is dazzling. Wealth and excess. Splendor. Even this TRAIN STATION.  27. Everything gleams, overly bright. The colors look like ca Beautiful MUSIC drifts through hidden speakers. The CITIZ here are well-dressed, well-fed. And attentive: They stop, and wave at us. (The arrival of a Tribute Trai avery big deal around here.) Adults, kids, waving at us. Katniss, looking out the window of her compartment, can't quite bring herself to wave back. But Peeta can - leaning out of his window, right next to hers, waving graciously. The crowd loves it. Katniss does

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haymitch and Effie lead the two junior celebrities throug the station. Feels like another planet to Katniss. They pass a VIRTUAL NEWSSTAND. One face appears on DOZENS I-MAGAZINE COVERS: "Seneca Crane - the genius behind the Hunger Games." Something tells Katniss to study this face A GIRL passes by, Katniss's age... with two healthy paren clean hair, a poodle on a leash... and an ice cream cone her hand. Licking happily.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: (re: ice cream) What's that? Effie laughs, certain that Katniss was kidding.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: silly! But Haymitch knows better. He leads them away. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss just saw her first RESTAURANT. Ever. A clean plac where families eat... as she and Peeta are driven down th biggest street_in The Capitol. Think Emerald city - but with a sinister underbelly. The colors are heightened and saturated. The architecture is immaculate. People are grinning. But it all feels synthet

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Now I know where all that coal goes.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Let's get you two cleaned up already! You're being presented today! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EFFIE (cont'd) (Katniss eyes her) No one's going to sponsor you looking like this, Katniss. Could you blame them? A look from Haymitch tells Katniss not to fire back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rippp! A woman named VENIA yanks a strip of WAX off our l

dialogues.speaker: VENIA
dialogues.text: (pitched Capitol accent) Sorry! But you're just so hairy! Katniss is naked, silent. And surrounded: eyebrows plucke a man named FLAVIUS, nails shaped by a portly woman named OCTAVIA - (each with that same pitched Capitol accent.)

dialogues.speaker: FLAVIUS
dialogues.text: You're doing very well! If there's one thing we can't stand, it's a whiner! Katniss doesn't reply - she hasn't said a word in hours.

dialogues.speaker: OCTAVIA
dialogues.text: (gossippy, to Venia:) I'1l tell you who'd be fun to prep. That Glimmer girl. The tall one. She's gorgeous! Those eyes!

dialogues.speaker: VENIA
dialogues.text: I know! And those white white teeth!

dialogues.speaker: OCTAVIA
dialogues.text: (to Katniss) I have to admit it, I had the tiniest thrill when they pulled your sister's name at The Reaping! (Katniss tightens) I mean, her precious little face! I just couldn't stop thinking of all the ways we'd get to dress her and make her up! Little Rose Everdeen!

dialogues.speaker: VENIA
dialogues.text: I know! Me too! (at Katniss) Not that we were disappointed when it turned out to be you! No. Now that we've gotten rid of all that hair and filth, you're not horrible at--  29.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Prim. Katniss's first word. In hours. The others eye her.

dialogues.speaker: VENIA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: It's Prim. And she hates make-up. A beat... Then these three howl with LAUGHTER. Peals of i

dialogues.speaker: VENIA
dialogues.text: You're hysterical! Let's go get Cinna! They vanish. Katniss, alone and naked, grabs a robe. Then she notices - she's being watched: Three stories above this room, visible through its glass ceiling, FIFTEEN PEOPLE look down at her from an interior balcony - each of them sipping a cocktail... e@ These are the GAMESMAKERS - studying the Tributes in e Prep Room without expression. (Seneca is not among them.) Katniss eyes them, utterly unnerved. Afraid... until:

dialogues.speaker: CINNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How despicable we must seem to you. She turns. Standing in the doorway is CINNA, (30). He see decent, unaffected - even his voice. But she's wary.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your braid - who did it?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: My mother.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. Classic. We're not going to touch it. He enters, hits a button. The top of a table splits in tw and ANOTHER HUGE MEAL appears; Katniss won't react to it.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm Cinna, Katniss. I'll be your @ stylist - which means I'm here to help you survive. Are you hungry?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I'm scared. That came out reflexively, shocking her. Cinna's touched.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA
dialogues.text: I know. He smiles warmly. That fast, a trust begins to grow.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: How'd you get stuck with District 12? I know all the stylists hate it.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA
dialogues.text: They lack imagination. Katniss, I asked for District 12. I wanted the challenge, and not because I like those stupid coal-miner outfits the Tributes from Twelve always get presented in. Right? He might just be sincere. Human. He seems it. They sit.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have an idea, but it's going to require you to trust me a little. (a beat) Are you afraid of fire, Katniss? Yes, she is. On her face, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss wears a black unitard, knee-high leather boots, a cape of orange and yellow. Peeta's in the same outfit... +-.as they stand on a CHARIOT. Four horses up front. Up ahead, ANOTHER CHARIOT vanishes around a corner into t BRIGHT-LIGHTS of a street outside. But our Chariot hasn't been sent out yet. Cinna grins, excited.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA
dialogues.text: It's not real fire, of course. Just some synthetic flames Portia and I came up with. I want them to remember you. Be right back. He steps a few feet away, where a woman named PORTIA fuss with a FLARE that seems to be malfunctioning. The two of tinker with it as Katniss and Peeta wait, anxious.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: What do you think about this?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I'll rip off your cape if you rip off mine.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, got it! Here we go! He approaches, that flare LIT now. Katniss's eyes go wide

dialogues.speaker: CINNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Meet Katniss Everdeen - the Girl Who Was on Fire! lights their capes on "fire". SYNTHETIC FLAMES suddenly rise up around us - looking awfully real.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA
dialogues.text: It works! Thrilled, he makes a SSSSST sound at the HORSES up front. They begin to trot - and we're moving. +--all of it before Katniss can adjust to the fact that h cape is now burning. Cinna calls out to them:

dialogues.speaker: CINNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Heads high! Smiles! They're going to love you! Oh, and hold hands! +..as we're pulled through MASSIVE OPEN DOORS and onto:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide boulevard - filled with CHARIOTS bearing the OTHER PAIRS OF TRIBUTES, gliding ahead of us gracefully. But none of those Tributes are on fire - which is why CHEERING CITIZENS, ten-deep, now gape at the sight of us, dazzled. Katniss has to SHOUT:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Shouldn't Haymitch be around to protect us from this sort of thing?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Last thing I want is Haymitch near an open flame! Here.  32. He takes her hand. The CROWD ROARS: "Twelve! Twelve!" It' thrilling. Cinna gives a thumbs-up. Katniss glances to her left, where a GIANT TV SCREEN give her an oversized look at herself and Peeta, in flames. A escapes her lips. Is that me?! The crowd blows kisses, calling out her NAME now: "Katnis Katniss!" It gives her an odd feeling of hope. A CITIZEN throws her a red rose. She catches it, blows a kiss back. A HUNDRED HANDS reach up to catch her kiss. Wow. She look down, noticing now that she is squeezing the color out of Peeta's hand. She releases it - until he stops her:

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: No, don't let go of me. I might fall out of this thing!

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Okay. It feels now like every eye is on Katniss and Peeta, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BROADCAST BOOTH, like you'd see at The Rose Parade. CLAUDIUS TEMPLESMITH is doing play-by-play live. He has a special guest tonight: Seneca, doing "color".

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Tell me, Mister Crane. What are you looking for at this point in the proceedings? What characteristics in a Tribute catch your eye?

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: I'd imagine I'm looking for the same things bettors look for: athleticism, intelligence. Except my goal is to deliver a great event, as opposed to picking a winner.

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH
dialogues.text: That you do, Sir. That you do. Your Games can always be counted on for great drama and breathless pace! (inside joke:) And even on those rare occasions when they hit a slow patch, we know we can count on you to liven things up - when appropriate of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, now, Claudius. Don't go starting trouble! You know that my Gamesmakers and I would never do anything to influence the outcome of The Games.

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH
dialogues.text: Just now and then! Only now and then! (laughs...) Dazzling display tonight from District 12; the crowd certainly seems taken with it. That's the girl who volunteered for her sister, hmm?

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Quite a thing. Probably the biggest moment District Twelve has given The Games in a few decades. Sad to say. BACK TO KATNISS - cheers from the crowd flowing over her. It's an overwhelming experience - noise, light, energy. T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massive doors close behind us. The parade's over. Silence And the letdown is profound: Buzz-kill, just like that as Katniss now faces ALL THE RE OF THE TRIBUTES. 22 children, most of whom will soon be d They exit their chariots, disrobing like strippers backst at a bad club. Katniss lets go of Peeta's hand.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Thanks for keeping hold of me. I was getting a little shaky there.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: It didn't show.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: You should wear flames more often. They suit you. That said with a shy smile that Katniss can almost believ She removes her flaming cape. Above her is another HUGE T

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Hopefully, she'll be the picture people remember from The Reaping - as opposed to Haymitch Abernathy's stumbling drunkenly on to the stage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss notices the dark-skinned girl from District 11, R just a child, looking awfully shaky as she removes her costume. For some reason, Katniss keeps staring at her...

dialogues.speaker: SENECA, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Frankly, that's something I wish * hadn't been aired. The Games are * meant to be family entertainment, after all. Katniss tightens, sick inside. ..-which is when Haymitch and Effie arrive.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: That was wonderful! Wonderful! I knew there was a pretty girl under there somewhere! And you too, Peeta. Katniss barely heard that - still watching Rue...

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I always say, if you put enough pressure on coal it turns to pearls!

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Oysters. *

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Hmmm?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Pearls come from oysters. * Effie tightens... Across the room are Tributes we'll come to know: CATO and CLOVE from District 2. GLIMMER and MARVEL from District 1 all of them sculpted athletes. Katniss looks to Peeta.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There they are. The Careers.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: I really wish you'd stop using that term, Katniss. It's unsportsmanlike. Katniss notes a FOX-FACED GIRL from District 5, and a ste looking kid from District 4 - call him BRAVURA - as a wom enters: CALLOWAY, carrying a large box. Effie sighs.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ugh. Paperwork!  35.

dialogues.speaker: CALLOWAY
dialogues.text: Mentors, I have the Pre-Games Packages - please distribute them to your Tributes. All forms must be completed before entering the Training Center: burial preferences, ergans to be donated, et cetera. There are also six personalized condolence cards in each package. If anyone needs more, please see me. This said as if she were handing out sandwiches. Katniss spots the tiny little wisp from District 11 again Rue, whose hand is trembling so badly from fear that she drops the papers her MENTOR just handed to her. The boy from District 11 is THRESH: huge, iron-strong... kind. He calms Rue with a smile, grabs the papers for her .-.as Katniss watches, unable to turn away...

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Don't let her distract you; it might just be a stunt. (Katniss studies Effie) Johanna Mason, a few years ago - she wept through the whole Training Week, never saw such a scared little puppy! Then Day One of the Games she hatcheted six kids in two minutes! And won! Sign, Dear. It's late. Effie hands her a pen and the papers. Katniss glances at them, then at Peeta. He nods. She takes the pen... ... when she's brushed aside, rudely, by Cato - as he and other Careers (Districts 1, 2, and 4), blow out of here. She watches Cato go, then signs the papers...

dialogues.speaker: DUSK
dialogues.text: Gale, atop that bed of coal. He's hungry and cold. As the train pulls through a RURAL TRAIN STATION, he peeks out - sees something odd on the station platform: Those WILD DOGS - the size of bulls - we saw them hunted long ago. A few of them sleep in chains on the platform, drugged, being loaded into TRANSPORT CAGES by HUNTERS. Gale gets just a glimpse of it as the train pulls away...  36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Effie lectures Katniss and Peeta while touring them throu the TRAINING CENTER. Haymitch is here too, but only barel

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: This is the Training Center, your * home sweet home until the Games * begin! Breakfast at seven, training * during the day; at night you'll be making appearances. Do either of you have any special skills?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Skills? The place is teeming with SUPPORT STAFF - to clean, to br towels, etc. Something odd about them though. Katniss tak notice... as Effie continues, with no help from Haymitch:

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: A talent that might be of use in the Arena. Anything.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: @ Katniss can shoot. Bow and arrow.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Then please don't go near one until * Evaluation Day! Right, Haymitch? * Haymitch nods absently. So Effie has to continue: *

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No need to let your competition know * your strengths, you see? *

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Isn't Peeta my competition too? Effie sighs, waiting for Haymitch to pounce. Forget it. T guy has checked out; it's less painful than engaging...

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: No. He's not. As of tonight he is your partner. (Katniss doesn't get it) The crowd loved you two as a couple up there. And where the crowds go, Sponsors follow! So from now on, you'll be joined at the hip - all © through your Training Period.  37. @ Peeta nods. Katniss doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: What about you, Peeta? Any special skills?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I work all day. My father's bakery.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Oh. And what do you do for him?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I make cakes.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: That should come in handy - if you ever need to frost someone to death. Katniss eyes Haymitch, Thanks for chiming in. Then:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: He can wrestle. I've seen him. He's * strong.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: @ Congratulations. No wrestling during * " training. Confine yourselves to knot- * tying or something. Two CUSTODIANS pass by, pushing carts. Again, something o about them - a dullness in their eyes...

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: As you can see, there are Avoxes all over the Training Center. They're here to make your stay more comfortable. So don't hesitate to--

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: What's an Avox?

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: My Goodness, what a rube. (Katniss tightens) Avoxes are criminals of the State, traitors. They work - and they don't bitch - mostly because their tongues've been cut out. That sickened Katniss. She suddenly takes a second look a @ TOWEL-BOY she'd just walked past, his eyes lifeless.  38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look like a traitor to me.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: I wonder if you might become less * sullen at some point. * No reply. An ELEVATOR OPENS. They enter.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Katniss, we really are all you've got. You should treat us as friends. Katniss's look says, "Not too likely."

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well try and pretend! (calmly smiling...) See? Like this. I'm smiling at you even though you're aggravating me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haymitch presses "12." The car starts to rise, quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve. Like the District. We get the whole floor. Katniss is unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You should listen to Effie, Darling; you need to be liked this week. If the people like you, you'll get more Sponsors, and Sponsors pay for the Gifts that might just keep you alive once you're inside The Arena - assuming I like you enough to send them and Seneca likes you enough to let me. So a little less... disdain would make sense here. Wouldn't it? Katniss pauses. Haymitch, Effie, and Peeta studying her..

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: My eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Hmmm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The organs I just agreed to donate. *  39. The doors open. Katniss bursts out. They watch her go. INT. CAPITOL - TRAINING CENTER - KATNISS‘S ROOM - NIGHT A clean, well-appointed room. Katniss enters, miserable. Dinner is waiting here for her. On a silver tray. Steak, rice, salad... and a scoop of ice cream. She smashes the plates to the floor. Backs away, reeling. But that fast, her door opens - and a random, anonymous A (female) enters with a tray. The Avox kneels down to clea the mess. Katniss turns, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Oh. I can do that. It's my... The Avox starts cleaning, gathering broken pieces... Katniss can't take it. She bends down, and starts helping with the clean-up. Two girls, silently fixing a mess. ++.until something takes Katniss's breath away: the face this Avox - because we've seen her before. She is Lavinia, the red-haired girl netted by that hoverc in the forest last year, while Katniss did nothing to hel And now she's an Avox. Her tongue cut out. Cleaning up a made by my tantrum. Katniss sags, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: I...
dialogues.text: But there's nothing to say. Lavinia dips a napkin in some water, reaches for Katniss's hand - Katniss noticing only that she'd cut herself when she smashed the dishes. Gently, slowly, Lavinia cleans Katniss's wound - Katniss chagrinned to speak. Receiving kindness from a slave.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I should have saved you. I should've tried. No reply, of course. But there's a faint response in Lavinia's eyes. Then she takes the tray from the room. * Katniss, alone again. It all feels like a horrifying drea  40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens. Peeta steps on to the roof of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to find Katniss alone, eyeing the brightly-lit city be

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Must be what a city looks like when they leave the power on. Katniss nods. Can't quite participate in small-talk.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you were thinking of jumping, don't bother. He picks up a pebble, tosses it off the roof... It bounce back in mid-air, as if it'd hit an invisible wall.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Plasma field.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: They're worried about our safety. It's touching.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I guess you're not too happy with our support team.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I just don't like pretending. Ina couple days I'm gonna have to kill you or you'll have to kill me or--

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Stop. I would never do that, Katniss. * I couldn't. * That threw Katniss, the certitude of it. She's silent.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm not going to let all this change * me - or turn me into something I'm not.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: You're not planning to kill anybody?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: No. I'll kill, like everyone else; I can't go down without a fight. But, I * want the Capitol to see that they * (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4l. PEETA (cont'd) don't own me, that I'm more than just a piece of their Games. Ya know? If I die, I'm going to die as myself. I'm not gonna turn into a monster in there. 'Cause then they win.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: They've won already. Don't you know that?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: What I mean is, you can count on me.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Well don't count on me, Peeta. I'm gonna do whatever I have to to get home again.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Good. You should. But there's nothing wrong with letting people help you.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Right. I know. I'm supposed to smile a lot and try to charm everybody - or convince them what a great-looking team you and I make. And why? So_ my death will be more interesting to them. I can't do that. Can you? (Peeta lets that go) They're sending us in there to kill each other. Oh, and on the way, give us some human-interest stuff too. Sorry. When I die they can just say, "Well, there goes that sullen girl from District 12. Too bad we didn't get to know her better."

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: What if going along might... give you a better chance to survive?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: If that's all it takes, Peeta, I'm pretty sure you'll be the one who's still standing at the end. That wounded him. She leaves him alone on the roof...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MASSIVE SPACE: stations set up for archery, knife-throw fire-building, rope-climbing, botany, wrestling, sprintin The Tributes will be evaluated here. They file in now...  42. ++.as the Gamesmakers chat by a buffet. We find Haymitch, sampling the DRINK CART... until he sighs, and turns: Betto is right behind Haymitch - ready to emasculate:

dialogues.speaker: BETTO
dialogues.text: It's touching, your dedication to your Tributes. Makes me wonder why Tributes from 12 always seem to lose! He gestures to Katniss and Peeta, now entering the facili the only Tributes in here unaccompanied by a Mentor. Grea Haymitch puts his drink down, crosses the facility - unmo by the looks of disdain from his fellow Mentors. He reach Peeta, and a glaring Katniss. No "Hello".

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: You two will be evaluated last. The Gamesmakers are usually tired by then - you'll just have to get their attention somehow. Should be a good fit for you, Katniss, ‘cause it's the only pre-Games event that won't require you to be pleasant. Katniss notes the other Tributes: Cato, Clove, Marvel, Glimmer, Bravura... scoping the room out, undaunted.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: That mean you want us to try today?

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Your very best. Get a good score, and Sponsors will notice. Good luck! And may the odds be--

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS - of several Tributes being evaluated: -Glimmer, slicing a mannequin's head off with a sword. -Cato, lifting a boulder, smashing it to the ground. -Marvel, throwing a knife twenty yards at a target. Bulls -Clove, sweep-kicking a MALE SPARRING PARTNER. He goes do -Thresh, crushing a mannequin with a swung mace.  43. -Rue, using stones to start a fire. -FoxFace, racing through an obstacle course. Fast and agi -Bravura, hurling a trident. Another bullseye. The GAMESMAKERS keep score, sort of. Some DRINKING has be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clock ticks. Peeta sits against a wall. Katniss paces, turns a corner, finds a water fountain. Leans in, until:

dialogues.speaker: SENECA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well. Miss Everdeen. Seneca, a foot away. Smiling. Katniss tightens. All her bravado suddenly gone...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Sir. Hi...

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Brave thing you did, volunteering for your sister like that.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: You know, it's funny. I can control everything about the Games - except who's in them. So whenever we get a Tribute with a... compelling personal story, it's always very gratifying. How have your accomodations been?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Good. And have you seen any of the Evaluation sessions today? ee

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Oh, no. We've been in a Holding Room * all day. I think the Judges don't * want us checking out the competition. *

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Can I tell you a secret? * Huh? Katniss nods. Seneca leans in, and whispers: *

dialogues.speaker: SENECA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You just met him. Then he's gone. Katniss's hands are suddenly shaking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss enters the gym. The Gamesmakers barely turn. Some them tipsy now, most of them eyeing the BUFFET to their l She crosses to the ARCHERY STATION, grabs a bow and arrow takes aim at a DUMMY fifty yards away. Only half the Gamesmakers are even watching. She fires. .»--and misses left. A few more Gamesmakers turn away. Irritated, she makes a slight adjustment in the bow. ...and fires THREE RAPID SHOTS - hitting the Dummy in the heart, then the head, then severing the rope by which it hangs - but the Gamesmakers still aren't watching - becau

dialogues.speaker: GAMESMAKERS
dialogues.text: Hey!/That looks wonderful!/It's about time!/Fresh Meat! An AVOX just walked in with a ROASTED PIG on a tray. The Gamesmakers now have their backs completely turned to Katniss. It's infuriating - and her reaction is instant: She grabs an arrow, takes dead aim... and lets it fly. THWAK! The arrow hits the APPLE in the pig's mouth, pinni the pig to a wall - as the Gamesmakers drop to the floor frightened surprise. Silence hovers... Katniss, as shocked as any of them, drops her bow.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Thanks for your consideration. She heads for a door - passing Haymitch.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Smart, Katniss. Real smart.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: What can they do to me - kick me out of The Games?

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: No. But they might do something to your mother. Or to Prim.  45. That stopped Katniss flat...

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Capitol doesn't appreciate dissent. Haven't you noticed? Just then she realizes... that Seneca has been watching f one floor up. Dread rockets through her now. She runs out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss enters, shuts the door, slides down to the floor. And she lets it hit, for the first time, the terror and despair of all this. Tears come - in a wave, shaking her. Just a lost, frightened kid - sobbing... when:

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Katniss? Katniss? Effie, at the door, banging on it. Katniss can't move...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Please go away. Please... Effie keeps at it. Pounding. Katniss sobs, to no one...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wanna go home. Prim, I wanna come home! Lost, as the sun sets on the artificial candy Capitol...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seneca enters Mission Control. Everyone tightens. Electro BOARDS are alive with incoming data.

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: The Pre-Val scores have all been sent to your screens. Please see that they're posted. Betto looks at his screen. On it, a NUMERICAL SCORE besid the name of every Tribute. Cato got a 10, Glimmer a 9, Ma a 9, Rue a 7, Thresh a 10, Bravura an 8, Peeta an 8... ..-but there's no score beside Katniss's name. Betto paus

dialogues.speaker: BETTO
dialogues.text: Sir? Katniss Everdeen?

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Yes. Give her an Eleven. Silence in here. Maybe they heard him wrong. Seneca waits

dialogues.speaker: BETTO
dialogues.text: Um... Sir?

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: If she gets to a bow and arrow in there she's a very legitimate contender. That felt like a lie, but no one's going to say so.

dialogues.speaker: SENECA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just post it. No explanation. He just heads for his office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EYE SHADOW, applied to Katniss's closed eyes - as we HEAR

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Head up high, your hands should never be off your lap. And posture, very important. Strength and femininity.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thank you, Effie. Katniss, you can open your eyes now. Katniss's eyes open now... and she is stunned: ...by HER OWN REFLECTION: arms stenciled, hair woven in a lovely braid down one shoulder, make-up subtle and elegan And a jeweled DRESS, accented with tongues of fire. Not pretty. Not beautiful. Radiant as the sun.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Well there you are! A pearl! Cinna is beaming. His team squeals with delight. Katniss still hasn't spoken. Just too floored. Cinna gets it.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA
dialogues.text: Give us a moment, all right? His team EXITS. Effie shrugs unhappily, follows them. Now it's just Cinna and Katniss. She still hasn't spoken.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I look like....

dialogues.speaker: CINNA
dialogues.text: Like the girl you were meant to be. Let me see a twirl. She twirls, almost allowing the thrill of it.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh Katniss... (she blushes) I hope the Sponsors really see you tonight. Like this. The real you.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Haymitch says I'm sullen and hostile.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA
dialogues.text: You are - around Haymitch. (that helped) Forget him tonight. Once those cameras are on, try to pretend you're talking to a best friend back home. Do you have someone like that?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Yeah. His name's Gale. But he hates all this.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA
dialogues.text: He loves you, though. Doesn't he.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I dunno.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA
dialogues.text: Well, when you-see me sitting in that audience, pretend I'm him. Can you do that? (she nods) Listen, I lied to you the other day - about the reason I asked for District 12. It was you, Katniss. What you did for your sister, how brave you were. Tonight requires... a different kind of bravery, okay? (that registered) Let them love you out there. It might just save you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss joins the OTHER TRIBUTES, each made-over, backsta at an AMPHITHEATRE. Peeta, in a black suit with flame accents, nods to her. No one else acknowledges her at all ...except for Rue, in a gossamer gown with wings, who off her a nervous smile. Katniss mouths to her: “You look nic Rue blushes, as a MAN rushes past. He is CAESAR FLICKERMA his face painted white; his hair, lips, and eyelids powde blue. His suit dotted with tiny light bulbs. We hear:

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, your host for the evening, Caesar Flickerman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOUD APPLAUSE. Peppy music. A STAGE with 24 CHAIRS on it. +..as Flickerman bounces out, urging more applause...

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Thank you, and welcome to the show! I hope you’ve brought your appetite for fun, because tonight I go one-on- one with the Tributes for the 74th Hunger Games! And here they are! More APPLAUSE - as the Tributes walk on stage, single fil filling those waiting chairs. Katniss is almost on stage Haymitch tugs at her arm - eyeing her and Peeta.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Remember, you're still a happy pair - so act like it. Peeta nods. Katniss too, sort of. Haymitch pushes them ou ..-onto the Stage, where APPLAUSE echoes, CAMERAS everywh In the Balconies are the Gamesmakers. Katniss braces hers all too aware that all of Panem is watching:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing moves. CITIZENS watching on giant screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every citizen of The Seam, watching, hoping... as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marvel, interviewed by Flickerman. 23 other Tributes wait

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Marvel, we hear so much about alliances formed during The Games - tributes banding together in the early stages. Do you have a strategy in that regard?

dialogues.speaker: MARVEL
dialogues.text: Seems really weird to me, joining up with people you're supposed to be competing with. I think I'd be better off just killing them.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Oh my... Laughter and applause from the crowd - as we CUT TO: -Cato, getting his turn now:

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Cato, you're from District Two, which has produced the last two winners of The Games. Does that bring any burden with it for you?

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: (calm as Tom Brady:) It is a great responsibility, a lot to live up to. But it's also a privilege - to follow in the footsteps of such great champions. I just have to match their intensity. Warm applause. Katniss hates this guy already. We JUMP TO -Foxface, the red-headed girl from 5.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: So your name's Marissa but everyone calls you Foxface. Because you’re a redhead?

dialogues.speaker: FOXFACE
dialogues.text: No, Sir. Because I’m tricky. Sly grin. She holds up his wristwatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HH ee ee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: e FLICKERMAN My watch! He looks at his bare wrist in astonishment. The audience LAUGHS appreciatively. We CUT TO: -Bravura, flexing huge arms for Flickerman to gape at:

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Can you really lift two hundred pounds? Bravura grabs Flickerman and lifts him over his head. Wow

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess he can! Big applause. We CUT TO: -Rue, in that gossamer gown, a shy butterfly.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: I’m very hard to catch. And if they can’t catch me, they can’t kill me. So don’t rule me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t in a million years, Darling. He puts his arm around her and kisses the top of her head An AWWWWW rises from the crowd. We CUT TO: -Thresh, arms crossed with hostility, staring straight ah

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Do you have a weapon of choice, Thresh?

dialogues.speaker: THRESH
dialogues.text: I like knives.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Any special reason?

dialogues.speaker: THRESH
dialogues.text: I think you should be close enough to * look somebody in the eyes when you kill them. Distance is for cowards.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: @ Perhaps I'll just scoot my chair a few inches farther away from you!  51. Big laughter and applause. Thresh sits. Flickerman looks Katniss, who wipes her hands nervously on her dress.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And now, from District Twelve, the girl who was on fire, Katniss Everdeen! Katniss crosses to Flickerman amidst APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Katniss, when you came out in the opening ceremonies, my heart actually stopped. What did you think about that costume? And Katniss goes blank. Silence. Uh-oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she spots Cinna, in the audience. That helps.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: You mean after I got over my fear of being burned alive? The audience LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Start then.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I thought Cinna was brilliant and it was the most gorgeous costume I'd ever seen. I couldn't believe I was wearing it. I can't believe I'm wearing this either!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss looks to Cinna, who makes the tiniest circular mo with his finger, twirl for me. Katniss hesitates... then: She twirls. The Audience eats it up.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Oh do that again! She does so. More love from the Audience.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I would give you, and that dress, an ELEVEN - which reminds me of your Training Score. Tell us about that. Katniss pauses demurely... then:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: All I can say is, I think it was a first.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Are you at all afraid it might put a target on your back?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I doubt my fellow Tributes paid much attention to it.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Brave girl! Let's go back to the moment they called your sister's name at The Reaping. And you volunteered. Can you tell us about her? Not an easy thing to do. Katniss gathers herself...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Her name’s Prim. She’s just twelve. And I love her more than anything.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: What did she say to you after The Reaping?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
