dialogues.text: She asked me to try really hard to win. And I swore I would.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: I bet you did. I bet you did. (that hovers...) Sorry we're out of time. Best of luck, Katniss Everdeen, Tribute from District Twelve! BIG APPLAUSE. Cinna gives Katniss a thumbs up. She sits,

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And welcome Peeta Mellark! More applause. Peeta rises. Katniss watches him go...

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Peeta, you were covered in flames as well, hmmm?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it’s different for me. I run the ovens at my family’s bakery. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEETA (cont'd) . So I catch on fire two, three times a © week anyway. The audience LAUGHS. Katniss is watching, assessing him.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Then you’re used to danger.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: My mother - when we don't get our deliveries made on time - that's danger. More LAUGHTER. Peeta is shockingly good at this...

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Do you have a girlfriend back home?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: A handsome lad like you? There must be some special girl. Come on, what's her name? e Peeta sighs, charming the crowd. Katniss just a spectat

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Well, there is this one girl. I’ve had a crush on her ever since I can remember. But it’s not reciprocated. Crowd MURMURS sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Oh. She have another fellow?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. A lot of boys like her.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: So here's what you do. You win, and return home in triumph. She can’t turn you down then, eh?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Actually, with this girl, winning won't help me.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: e Why ever not?  54.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Because...she came here with me. What?! We PUSH IN ON Katniss; her eyes wide: Me/ He means The STUDIO CAMERAS bore in on her, capturing forever her of surprise and protest. The CROWD sighs. .»--as Peeta milks it, staring at his shoetops...

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: That is a bad piece of luck.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: It's not good.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: I can hardly blame you. It'd be hard not to fall for that young lady. More applause. Katniss smoldering. Peeta smiling nervousl A few in the audience weeping now.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wouldn't you just love to pull her back up here and get a response?! (the CROWD roars) Sadly, rules are rules, and her time is up. But best of luck to you, Peeta Mellark - and I think I speak for all of Panem when I say our hearts go with yours.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Thank you. He returns to his seat. The crowd cheers. Katniss stares straight ahead. A BAND starts playing the NATIONAL ANTHEM Everyone in the building rises - but the SCREENS in here filled with a single TWO-SHOT, Katniss and Peeta, the new minted stars of this show. On her face, burning, we CUT T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! Katniss puts both palms into Peeta's chest, knockin him backward. He falls into a potted plant, cutting his h

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: What was that for?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: You had no right to do that!  55. @ Effie and Haymitch rush over, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: What happened?!

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Nothing. I fell. Haymitch pulls Peeta up, noting the blood on Peeta's hand

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Did you put him up to this?

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: I wish I had. It played great. That angered her even more. Peeta stays silent.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: You owe him a thank you, Katniss. You just crossed-over out there!

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: e It means he just gave everybody outside District Twelve a reason to give a damn about you.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: He made me look weak.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: He made you look desirable, which might be enough to save your life tomorrow. The Star-Crossed Lovers from District 12. Sponsors go for--

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: But we're not Star-Crossed Lovers!

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Then fake it. Because whatever those people want to buy, it's our job to sell it to them. Understand? (a beat) Or would you rather do it your way - and die? e Katniss eyes them both... then walks away. We DISSOLVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss, alone. It's the night before the Games, and she' wreck, no chance of sleeping. Staring at that Mockingjay Then, a knock at her door. Must be Peeta. Great. She cros to it, annoyed. Opens it. That fast, her jaw drops - because: Gale is standing here. Cleaned up. Dressed like an AVOX.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Hi, Katniss. Before Katniss can formulate a reply, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haymitch sits alone - buzzed, not hammered - until:

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You really ought to get some sleep tonight, Haymitch. Effie. She seems less pitched than usual. More genuine.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you sober?

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Basically. Mostly. Had to honor my pledge to our Tributes. (no reply) Besides, tonight is not about booze. It's about bread and circuses.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Somebody asked a Roman emperor once, "How do you get a public to give up all its rights without a protest?" And he said, "Easy. Just give them bread and circuses."

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Haymitch! Govern yourself! People could be listening. And she goes. He pounds his fist on the table...  57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss pulls Gale into her room, scared to death for him

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: How did you--

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: A coal train. Then I stole an i.d. to get around the city.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: That was reckless, Gale. They kill people for infiltrating the Capitol.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I thought I could help you.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: You can help me by taking care of Prim and my mother. I can't do this if I'm worrying about-- *

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: It's Prim that asked me to come. She * @ wanted you to see something. *

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Ooh. He extracts something from inside the jumpsuit he's been wearing. Four pieces of ARTIST'S PAPER. He lays them out: FOUR DRAWINGS OF KATNISS stare up at us now. Sketches, lovingly rendered. Beautiful... She sags a bit.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gale. You shouldn't've--

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I didn't draw them, Katniss. Peeta did. We saw his Mom throwing them * into a dumpster after The Reaping. Katniss is silent; it's a lot to take in.

dialogues.speaker: GALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don't like trusting people; I * know that. But this time you should. * He'll protect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Guys do dumb things sometimes, when they're... The sentence fades; he can't finish it. Tons going unsaid

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: We didn't get to say goodbye, before.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: No. And I'm not gonna say it now. ‘Cause I'm planning to see you again, after The Games. Okay? (she shrugs, doubts it) You're the best hunter I know, Katniss. Even better than me. You know how to kill.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Not people.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: How different can it be, really? That hovers. They're both sad as hell.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: You should go. There's a curfew.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: I'm serious. I'm not saying goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Then... She puts those three fingers to her lips, offering him th same wordless gesture. He nods, eyes welling. Returns it. Then he opens the door. And her eyes go wide once again: ..-because Lavinia is out here, waiting in the hall. Gale nods to her - which tells Katniss that Lavinia is the one got him into this building. Hence Katniss's utter awe.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: We'll be watching... Katniss is speechless. Lavinia can't acknowledge it. Gale nods, smiles... then follows the Avox down the hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A decadent showplace, acres of brightly-lighted darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HHH HH  59. @ GIANT ELECTRONIC BOARDS in here give us COLOR-CODED ODD every sporting event in Panem - numbers that change at dizzying speeds as bets come in from across the nation. One electronic wall is dedicated solely to the Hunger Gam There are "proposition bets" here - odds on which Tribute will die first, what the first cause of death will be, an “over-under" on how many Tributes will fall on the first And, of course, there are odds on who's going to win. At the top are the favorites. Cato at 3-to-1l. Marvel at 2. Thresh at 4-to-1. Peeta's way down, at 25-to-1. Even a this hour, the line at the BETTING WINDOWS is twenty-deep Haymitch stands in the back of the Sports Book, eyeing al those numbers... until his eyes land on the BOTTOM of the betting board, where the LONG-SHOTS are listed. There, listed at 100-to-1... is Katniss Everdeen. * Haymitch tightens. She's going to die, and he knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: @ Dawn breaks. Katniss awakens... and gasps: .--because Haymitch is here, kneeling by the edge of her Hasn't slept all night. He leans in with quiet urgency:

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: When the gong sounds, get the hell out of there. The Cornucopia is always a blood-bath, and you're not up to it. Just clear out, put as much distance as you can between yourself and the others, and find a source of water. I'm not gonna send you anything you can find on your own. Katniss nods. He's about to go on, when: A_MOUNTED TV _pops_on, "Reminding all Tributes to wake up gather in the Lobby of the Training Center!" Haymitch eyes it anxiously. Katniss too... until:

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember this - it's important: You don't win in there by killing * e people - despite what Seneca thinks. You win by not dying. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Katniss nods) Run. Hide. Cheat if you have to. Let them kill each other. But stay alive. Katniss got that, every word. On her face, we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tributes are airlifted in a HOVERCRAFT. No one talks just eyeing one another, or the floor. A NURSE carrying a nasty-looking SYRINGE approaches Katni

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Still, please. This is your tracker. Katniss nods. Nurse injects her forearm, painfully, and m on to Rue. Katniss stares out the window. Wilderness belo Then the windows suddenly BLACK OUT - screens rising up.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I guess we're getting close...

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: A VAN, its windows BLACKED OUT. The Tributes ride in sile Fists clenching, unclenching, feet tapping, throats clear Cato doing PUSH-UPS. The van disappears into a tunnel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PEACEKEEPER leads Katniss to a door. On it, the words, "This Launch Room was used on Day One of the 74th Hunger Games by Katniss Everdeen - Female, District 12." Peacekeeper opens the door, revealing a dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in simple tawny pants, light green blouse, brown be thin hooded black jacket, leather boots over socks. Cinna braids her hair. Katniss just stares. Numb silence.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA
dialogues.text: Expect some cool nights. The jacket's designed to reflect body heat. She nods, tries to affix her mockingjay pin onto her outf But her hand is shaking so badly, she can't do it. Cinna smiles warmly, takes the pin, affixes it for her.

dialogues.speaker: CINNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you want to talk, Katniss? She shakes her head. He takes her hand. There are no word Just dread, hanging... until they hear a GONG - and their eyes lock - as the voice echoes loudly:

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, let the 74th Hunger Games begin! So this is it. She shuts her eyes tight. Opens them again Cinna nods, trying to be of comfort. But he's fighting te Katniss moves to a CIRCLE cut into the floor. So scared..

dialogues.speaker: CINNA
dialogues.text: I want you to know something - we're not allowed to bet. But if I could, my money would be on you. {she half-nods) Good luck, Girl on Fire... She shakes, terrified, as the circle - a PLATFORM - rises pushing her up. The ceiling above her OPENS into darkness

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUING
dialogues.text: She stands on the platform, rising through a pitch-black CYLINDER. Heart thumping. As she hears:

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tributes, the Arena is about to be revealed to you. DO NOT leave your platform until the countdown has concluded. The penalty will be severe. The platform rises. Then, BLINDING LIGHT from above. DAYLIGHT. Katniss's cylinder now emerges from blackness,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she sees it, at last: the ARENA. It's a FOREST - to h right is a LAKE. To her left, sparse piney WOODS. And all around her, the 23 OTHER TRIBUTES, each emerging as she does, their platforms settling now. 24 sets of eye landing on the very same thing - 100 yards from here: A giant golden CORNUCOPIA, its mouth 20 feet high, spilli over with life itself: food, water containers, fire-start medicine, blankets, backpacks, and WEAPONS. As we hear:

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Good Luck! And may the odds be ever in your favor! A CLOCK begins to tick down. 60, 59, 58, 57... Katniss scans the Cornucopia - all those weapons. Knives, spears, maces, clubs. And a BOW AND ARROWS... 40 seconds, 39, 38... There's nothing but a plain of hard packed dirt between her and that bow, except the fact tha the 23 other Tributes might be running for it too. She swallows hard, her breaths shallow. Watching the othe Cato, Clove, Marvel, Glimmer, Thresh, Bravura - they all so steely. Aren't they terrified too? They don't seem it. But Rue does. The little thing is trembling. Fox-Face too 20 seconds, 19, 18... The whole world is that bow. Katnis has to have it. Then she sees Peeta, looking right at her shaking his head as if to talk her out of running for it. Concentration broken, that fast. Katniss loses her edge. Nine seconds, 8, eyes darting, 6, 5, hands clenched, 3, 2 ...until Bravura can't wait any longer. He steps off his platform just as the clock hits one, and: ..-he EXPLODES, just like that. A LANDMINE - sending piec of him spraying in all directions. The countdown stops. No one breathes. Or blinks. We hear a CANNON BLAST. Then the clock resumes - ONE, ZERO - before Katniss can regroup. And a LOUD GONG goes off. .--and it has begun. The Tributes burst from their platfo racing for the Cornucopia. It's a dizzying, chaotic blur - CHILDREN, running for weapons. We hear our first SCREAM. Katniss turns. A GROAN nearby - someone dying. CANNON BLAST #2. There's a loaf of bread ten feet away, beside a folded up sheet of plastic and an orange BACKPACK. Katniss lunges forward, grabs the bread, the plastic, and... Wait, there are suddenly FOUR HANDS on the backpack: hers those of the BOY FROM 9. They grapple for it. Both confus disoriented, desperate. His eyes narrow, determined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a lost look crosses them. And red spray plumes from mouth. He staggers forward, releasing his grip on the pac «..revealing a knife in his back - thrown from 20 yards a by Clove, who has two more knives in hand. Katniss freeze Then she wheels, sprinting away while throwing the backpa over her shoulders. We hear a deadly WHIZZING sound... This knife implants itself in the backpack. Katniss keeps running, doesn't look back, leaving behind the horror of Cornucopia. Adolescents killing each other. And each time a body falls, another CANNON BLAST can be heard. Three, four, five... Katniss keeps running. We CUT

dialogues.speaker: 20 MINUTES LATER, (DAY)
dialogues.text: Katniss still running. She pulls off the backpack and rem the knife, slides the knife into her belt...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The land slopes down into a VALLEY. Katniss is jogging no head on a swivel - looking for danger... or water. Up ahead, she sees a rabbit. She reaches for her bow - ou habit. But she doesn't have one. Takes a tentative step. Startled, the rabbit runs away. Katniss swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss sits, parched and panting. Opens the backpack. The contents: One thin black sleeping bag, pack of cracke pack of beef strips, bottle of iodine, box of wooden matc coil of wire, sunglasses, a half-gallon water jug - EMPTY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desperately thirsty, she cuts into a tree with the knife, slicing away the outer bark to get to a softer inner bark Not easy to chew, but it'll have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rigs a TWITCH-UP SNARE at the base of a tree. In the distance, MORE CANNON BLASTS, several of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss, on a branch 50 feet up, bunking in:  64. She loops her BELT around a branch to secure her sleeping bag. Climbs in the bag...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours ago, there was a bloodbath here. Now all is still. Bodies lie on the ground, mere feet from the Cornucopia. Then DUST kicks up, a furious gust of air... as a HOVERCR descends. Tentacle-like ARMS extend from it, gathering th bodies one by one, pulling them up and in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seneca watches 13 SCREENS at once - monitoring each Tribu

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (V.O., ON TV)
dialogues.text: Night One ends with eleven Tributes dead, thirteen still in play. It's always thrilling to guess how it'll unfold from here, now that the jitters of Day One have gone and the Tributes have a moment to strategize. Their Mentors begin to play a role now too, scrambling to line up the Sponsors whose gifts might mean the difference between life and death. Certainly is a good time to have rich benefactors! By the way, for all you gamblers out there, the first three deaths today were the Boy from 4, and the Girls from 6 and 10. A 200-to-~1 shot if you bet it as an Exacta!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss is alone. NIGHT CREATURES chitter around her. Abo her, IMAGES are projected onto the sky. FACES... of today casualties: Bravura, and the Boy from 9, and others. But no Peeta. Katniss sighs, relieved. The last face is replaced by the CAPITOL SEAL, as the sounds of the NATION ANTHEM begin to soar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lavinia, the Avox, walks down a dank, dark STAIRWELL - Ga right behind her. Then Lavinia opens a door, revealing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fast, Gale is breathless. Aghast at what he's seeing  65. An underground BARRACKS. Row after row of tin BUNKS, trip stacked; swap the tin for wood and this'd be Auschwitz. Filthy. Scary. Home to 5,000 miserable INMATES: Avoxes - of every age. In every bunk. Their spirits broke eyes lifeless. Gale turns, stunned and humbled.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: This is where they... keep you? Lavinia nods. Gale's floored. She leads him to an empty b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss, belted onto that branch, is awakened - by the so of SNAPPING TWIGS. Her eyes bounce open, instant vigilanc A GIRL TRIBUTE runs by, fifty feet below - tired, hungry, scared. The Girl finds a nearby rock to hide behind. Katn stays still. SUPER: "DAY TWO". Then, a distinct sound: two rocks being rubbed together, sparking. And... SMOKE, a thin wisp of it, rising up from behind that rock. Katniss mutters, incredulous, to no one

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Idiot. The smoke snakes its way up. Her eyes close. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss is awakened again - this time by the HEAVY FOOTFA of SEVERAL PAIRS OF BOOTS, coming right at her. Trouble. She goes rigid, frightened to see SIX TRIBUTES down there running this way - hunting as a pack. Not good. They flank the large rock that the Fire-Starter is behind and Katniss hears the rest: A shocked scream. A plea for mercy. "Please!"... Then death. Followed by a CANNON BLAS The PACK-MEMBERS emerge from behind the rock. Katniss can their arms, legs - then faces - both Tributes from 1, bot Tributes from 2, the Girl from 4. And their voices now:

dialogues.speaker: GLIMMER
dialogues.text: What's he doing back there?

dialogues.speaker: CLOVE
dialogues.text: He's such a romantic - maybe he's cutting her heart out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others laugh; then a THIRD BOY emerges from the kill. And Katniss's eyes go wide. Utterly shocked to see:

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Let's go. ..-Peeta. Face swollen, a bloody bandage on his arm, figh in a pack with these monsters. A horrible betrayal. Katniss is frozen. I must be seeing things. But she's not It's Peeta. The Pack drifts away, as:

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Okay. Now we find your girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I tried to tell you, she wouldn't be dumb enough to start a fire. With that they're gone. Katniss is livid, reeling, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prim sits at a ragged desk in a threadbare SCHOOLROOM. He whole class watches The Games on a beautiful TELEVISION. Prim is watching her sister, as:

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Pack-hunting is a sound strategy; we see it every year. But it's the first time I can recall a Tribute from Twelve being included in one. Katniss seems pretty shocked by it too! Some boyfriend, that Peeta! Ouch! Templesmith chuckles. Prim just shuts her eyes, whispers:

dialogues.speaker: PRIM
dialogues.text: Katniss...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stillness. Then the top of this tree begins to blow sidew Katniss has to hang on, literally. A WHOOSH OF AIR. ..-.it's another HOVERCRAFT, descending. The arms extend it, disappearing behind that boulder. Next thing Katniss is the body of Fire-Starter Girl, vanishing into the craf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCORCHING SUN overhead - Katniss panting as she walks.  67. She pulls those SUNGLASSES from her backpack, tries them They distort her vision entirely. She puts them back agai drags herself to the site of the SNARE she'd set up. Insi a dead rabbit. She grabs it, wearily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cooks the rabbit over the still-hot coals of the fire left behind by the dead girl. But no smoke rises from it because she's rigged a CLOTH o the fire, propped up by sticks, to absorb the smoke. Her lips have cracked. She coats them with grease from th rabbit. Swallowing is an effort, like razors in her throa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wraps up half the rabbit, puts it in her pack. Steps from the tree's shade... into that killing sun again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parched, weak, she snaps a branch in two, turns it into a walking stick. Up ahead is a patch of BERRIES. At last. She kneels down, grabs at them, just about to pop them in her mouth... when she stops herself. She knows these berr

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Nightlock. She tosses them away and keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss sags against a boulder - lips burning, eyes shut, beating down on her. What comes out is a barely audible p

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Water, Haymitch. Please...

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. GAMES CENTER
dialogues.text: Haymitch, of course, is watching. Effie eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Water she can find on her own... He pours himself a cup of COFFEE, slugs down a bitter gul  68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss stumbles, weary. The ground starts to spin. She k moving, leaning on that stick. Then she drops, collapsing. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haymitch just saw that, of course - Katniss, in a heap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss is flat on her back, delirious. We MOVE IN ON HER FACE - then down her shoulders, an arm, a hand, fingers.. +..when we notice that they're moving in something. Mud. That means water. Her eyes SNAP OPEN. She rolls on to her stomach and starts to crawl, urgently, trying to find the source wetting this ground. Crawling in mud, like an anim Up ahead, a tangle of plants. She plows through it, to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: @ And there it is, a POND. But she doesn't drink from it. Instead she grabs her WATER-JUG, fills it. Drops an IODIN PILL into it - and starts counting:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: One, two, three, four, five, six... Still counting. The patience is inhuman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seneca, watching - along with 15 bored Gamesmakers...

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: How long since our last event?

dialogues.speaker: BETTO
dialogues.text: Eight hours ago, Sir. The girl from Seven, behind the rock.

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Then we're due. On my signal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss, waiting before she can drink the water safely...  69.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Two-hundred ninety-eight. Two-hundred ninety-nine... Three-Hundred. Now she can drink. She empties the jug into her mouth, al crying from relief. One long delicious chug. She refills it, drops another Iodine pellet in. Starts counting again. One, two, three-- ...until a THUNDEROUS SOUND snaps her head around. She tu ...toward a horror -- TERRIFIED ANIMALS, bursting out of woods in a STAMPEDE, coming this way... Because a WALL OF FLAMES is behind them - mountainous, fa moving - a FOREST FIRE, barrelling at us. Katniss is spun around and nearly trampled by the panicki animals. She turns, fleeing, carrying that jug like a football, her backpack bouncing on her back.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUING
dialogues.text: Suddenly, everything around her is on fire, every tree... dodges a burning BRANCH, jumps over a burning LOG. But th tail of her jacket catches on fire. She dives to the ground head-first, rolls over twice to smother the fire. Then she's off again, running alongside animals, their panicked screams adding to the terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prim, watching. It's unbearable. Around her, silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss gets to the other side of a huge rock ~ nothing burning within fifty yards of her. She sags back, gasping Searing pain in her chest, but she's unburned. She stuffs water-jug back into the backpack. +--until a strange thin HISS cuts the air. She looks up. «-.as a FIREBALL whizzes within an inch of her head, IMPLODING on the boulder behind her. This wasn't part of the forest fire. It was MAN~MADE, the size of an apple... and it was aimed right at her.  70. She bolts up, sprinting away. Hears another HISS. Flatten herself to the ground as a SECOND FIREBALL surges over he slamming into a tree, instantly immolating it. She gets to her feet. Running. Gasping. Smoke everywhere. THIRD HISS - this fireball so close it takes six inches o her braid. But she keeps running. No animals in sight now Fire on all sides of her. Up ahead is the edge of a CLIFF we can't see what's below it. A FOURTH HISS cuts the air. She runs blindly, eyes burning. The FOURTH FIREBALL blaze across her left calf, setting it on fire. Instant agony. Fire bearing down on her, that precipice up ahead... Anot HISS — another FIREBALL coming at her. She's running, cry @ying. And here comes the cliff. It's that or burn to dea SHE JUMPS, blind, no idea what's below -- that last FIREB barely misses her. Then she sees what's beneath her: A VALLEY FLOOR, 500-feet down. Death. She plummets, helpl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seneca and his Staff watch her tumble through the air... Seneca allows a grin, because he knows what's coming:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss, falling, hurtling into oblivion, eyes shut... .--when suddenly, she LANDS, in mid-air, bouncing up as i she'd hit an unseen TRAMPOLINE. Actually, she has. It's another PLASMA FIELD - stretching across this vast chasm. Christ. Katniss bounces on it gen now - in utter shock. A STEEL LADDER has been drilled into the face of the clif from which she just leapt. She eyes it, awed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seneca beams. The Staff applauds. He shrugs modestly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss is on solid ground again, lying on her belly, her hands plunged into a tiny pool.  71. @ The flames painted on her nails are chipping off. Good. had enough of fire now. She sits up, cuts the remains of pant-leg away, braces herself... and nearly faints: SEARED FLESH stares back at her. Her CALF, bright red. Sh tries to breathe, but can't. Agony is coming; she knows t She grabs the PLASTIC SHEET from her backpack, folds it i a palm-sized square. Puts it in her mouth, bites down... »-.-and plunges the leg into the pond. The pain is awful eyes tearing. But she leaves the leg in there. She swallows a gulp from her jug. Refills it again, drops another Iodine pellet in. Functioning... She empties her backpack, starts inventorying all her belongings again. Methodically. It's comforting somehow. looks around, spots a TALL PINE. The sun's setting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet night-shift. Betto at his monitor. Then something suddenly amuses him. He looks at his watch and calls out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. 10:36. You're an hour ahead of last year's time, Haymitch. Good! Reveal Haymitch - standing in the doorway, an object of s in here. Another Staffer, DELANO, grumbles.

dialogues.speaker: DELANO
dialogues.text: Damn it. Delano tosses Betto a 2-Florin COIN, (paying off a wager. Betto chuckles. Haymitch nods, used to it by now... *

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: My Tribute needs medicine, for her leg. I'd like to see Seneca--

dialogues.speaker: BETTO
dialogues.text: As always, he anticipated your request and ruled on it before he went to bed. But you can feel great about staying sober long enough to advocate on her behalf. Well done. Laughter from the Staffers cuts right through us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see him tomorrow then?  72.

dialogues.speaker: BETTO
dialogues.text: Tomorrow you'll be face-down drunk, just like every year. Please do let us know the exact time you take that first drink, though, ‘cause we have an actual office pool on that one. (more derisive laughter) See ya next year, Haymitch. A public undressing. And Haymitch can't fire back. He tur and leaves. Laughter follows him out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss climbs, wincing each time her calf hits bark. Ago

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty feet up. She settles painfully atop her sleeping ba The Capitol Seal fills the sky above. The Anthem plays. She closes her eyes, her hand clutching Clove's SERRATED KNIFE. We DRIFT DOWN, to that burned leg...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss is half-asleep, her leg aching... when she hears SPLASHING below. Her head snaps around. She looks down... «..to see the CAREER PACK: Cato, Clove, Marvel, Glimmer, GIRL FROM 4... and Peeta. All of them looking up at her.

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Well whaddaya know? Katniss tightens. Glimmer draws back that BOW.

dialogues.speaker: MARVEL
dialogues.text: Don't bother. I got her. He starts to climb the tree - pure menace, coming at us. Katniss is already fifty feet up, but there's ANOTHER BRA 30 feet higher. She puts the KNIFE in her teeth, and clim painfully, her calf searing. She endures it. Marvel, less nimble than Katniss, crashes back down to th ground, taking a low branch with him - as Katniss reaches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She settles in, protected by height and foliage. But:  73.

dialogues.speaker: GLIMMER
dialogues.text: I'll get her. Glimmer, her blue eyes blazing, fires an arrow - straight The arrow misses Katniss narrowly, runs out of steam, hit its apogee, and starts to fall back to Earth. Katniss grabs it in mid-air, and waves it mockingly at Th Careers. Glimmer smolders.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Let her stay up there. She's not going anywhere. We'll deal with her in the morning. Cato shrugs. The Careers drop their gear, settling in. Katniss is stuck now, 80 feet up. The Careers make camp..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARFLIES watch the Games. At a table in the corner Haymit sips quietly. Defeated. Numbing himself... until:

dialogues.speaker: GALE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What a coward you are. Haymitch looks up, and gets a shock: Gale —- standing her Haymitch is so thrown, he can't think up a reply.

dialogues.speaker: GALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She needs medicine - before that leg gets infected.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: It's Treason - sneaking into the Capitol. Punishable by Death. Don't you know that? Gale nods. Haymitch eyes him with drunken awe.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you risked it? For her? My, my. (no reply...) Two boys in love with her. I wish I'd known. It would've played great during the interviews.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: She could die.  74.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Kid, she's not likely to survive long enough for that burn to be the thing that kills her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale, his eyes now murderous, plants himself beside Haymi

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: You're supposed to be helping her - sending her what she needs.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: If the Gamesmakers approve it. If Seneca approves it.

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Then go to Seneca.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: I just did. He said no. And asking again would be viewed as an act of dissent. Gale reacts - awe and disgust. Haymitch reads his mind:

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm a coward. And a drunk. I doubt you'd do any better on your twenty-fourth Games. He gulps down the rest of his drink. Signals for another. it's over. But Gale won't let up:

dialogues.speaker: GALE
dialogues.text: Our fathers died together - in the mines. Did you know that? (Haymitch shrugs) It's how I met her, getting our condolence medals from the Mayor's Office. She was twelve - with a little sister and a mother who was falling apart. We started hunting together, to keep our families fed. I'll tell you something about her and those woods, they're the only place I ever saw her smile; she has a talent for them. The other Tributes don't know that yet, but they will. Personally, I don't think they have a chance against her. She's too good - if she has two legs to stand on. No reply. A WAITRESS sets another drink down. Uh-oh...  75.

dialogues.speaker: GALE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Her whole life, she's never had anybody to help her. Now she's got you - and that's it - against all this. Are you really gonna let her die in there from something you could've stopped? On Haymitch's face, eyeing that drink... we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss rests against the tree trunk, her seared calf dangling off the branch. Below, the Careers sleep. Then, a flicker. She squints, tracking it. Twenty feet aw A pair of EYES - watching her. Is it an animal...? She gr for that arrow, as if it might somehow defend her, then l closer, in spotty moonlight... until she realizes: The pair of eyes staring at her... they belong to RUE - w has been hiding on a neighboring tree all along. 80 feet A silent moment, two girls, staring at one another... whe Rue silently points a single finger, the universal gestur for "Look up, over your head." Katniss looks up... And there it is, right above her, hanging from a tall bra A WASPS' NEST. Big, round, the size of a beach-ball...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haymitch and Gale just saw that.

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Oh, Dear. Looks like she's picked the wrong branch to hide out on. That's a Tracker- ker nest above her. Two or three stings can be fatal. Gale fumes... as Haymitch closes his eyes with dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss looks up at the nest, then to Rue, then to the Careers sleeping below... And an idea hits her. She puts that knife back in her teeth, and climbs even higher. Agonizing, but she does it. Rue watching...  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches the sky-high branch supporting the NEST, able to hear the low, throaty BUZZ eminating from it. The branch is thin. She takes the knife from her teeth an Makes_a quiet cut on it. Gingerly. Silently. Then another Now we get it; she wants to saw this branch off. Might ta HOURS at this pace, but if she goes any faster or makes a noise she'll awaken the nest... and the Careers. So she continues - slowly, methodically - with Rue watchi from below. One patient cut after another. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peeta is awake, but he can't hear or see her from here.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Just want you to know - when we get her... She's mine. Reveal Cato, also awake. He nods, happy to oblige...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dawn. SUPER: "Day Three." Katniss hasn't slept. The branc nearly sawed off. She looks down to Rue, "Ready?" Rue nod 95 feet down, the Careers sleep... until: Movement: Cato, beginning to awaken. Katniss is out of ti So she starts SAWING. Fast. Desperate. The branch starts crack. The BUZZING in the nest grows louder. Cato looks u

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Hey! Katniss saws, fast as she can. The knife slips from her sweaty hands. She grabs at it, just barely catches it. ++.as the first TRACKER-JACKER angrily pops from the nest It's BIG, with a golden-torso. Flying right at us. It lan on Katniss's knee. A STABBING PAIN as it stings her. Another flies at her - stings her in the neck. More PAIN. blocks it out, keeps sawing - arm pumping, getting woozy. Rue hops to a distant branch like a lemur. Below, the oth Careers are awakening - Cato yelling, "Get up!" Katniss s desperate to get through the last sinews of the wood...  77. Then it's done. We hear a SNAP. Cato runs away, as the wh branch plummets toward the ground...

dialogues.speaker: WITH/EXT. BASE OF THE TREE
dialogues.text: The nest hits Earth and EXPLODES OPEN, TRACKER-JACKERS bursting out, enraged. That fast, they are a deadly swarm stinging anything that moves. Peeta gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: To the lake! To the lake! The sound is awful - buzzing mixed with screams. The Care run blindly, chased by the swarm, each stung repeatedly a they flee. Peeta too, legs pumping... But Glimmer and the Girl from 4 are caught in their sleep bags, quickly enveloped in a CLOUD OF WASPS. Overwhelmed. The Girl from 4, half-insane now, runs into a tree, stagg disappears behind a rock. Glimmer shrieks, tries to swat wasps with that bow, taking dozens of stings; then she fa Her body begins to spasm, twitching madly. Then, death. T Tracker-Jackers depart. And an odd SILENCE returns... Katniss is alone, (Rue nowhere in sight). She pulls the stingers from her knee and neck, then descends the tree..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches the ground, bearing her backpack. Already, WE are growing from the stings. Her calf still searing... She approaches the body of Glimmer, warily. It's barely h now - face distorted out of proportion. And still breathi The tip of that BOW peeks out from beneath her. Katniss reaches under the faintly-breathing body to extra the bow. Glimmer's eyes flicker. Katniss avoids them, gra the bow. Then the TEN ARROWS... They're still clutched in Glimmer's fist. Katniss tries t pry the fingers away. Glimmer holds tight - fighting, eve now. Her face a balloon, blood and GREEN OOZE everywhere. Katniss hears a CANNON, sees a HOVERCRAFT descending not from here to get the Girl from 4. Soon, the craft will be coming for Glimmer - so this has to be done: She grabs a rock and SMASHES IT DOWN on Glimmer's hand. T fingers release their grip. Katniss grabs the arrows.  78. Then, a shock: Peeta racing toward us, through branches. carrying a SPEAR, his body covered in WELTS. Katniss tries to stand. Can barely do it. Lifts her bow,

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Why're you still here?! Huh? Katniss is at a loss. Maybe hallucinating...

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go! Now! They're right behind me! Sure enough, we hear the SOUND OF THE CAREERS, coming thi way. Katniss studies Peeta - he came back here to save me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glimmer tries to yell. Peeta puts that spear into her che

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (at Katniss) Run. Urgency in his eyes. Katniss turns... and runs.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUING
dialogues.text: Katniss, running blindly, fleeing. She hears another CANN Up ahead is a POOL. She gets there, drops her backpack, d an - still clutching that bow and arrows... A moment later, bow drawn, she surfaces - ready to fire. But no one's coming. The woods are still, until they star move in a hallucinogenic way, swaying. Suddenly, ANTS app out of thin air, floating toward her. IMAGES, wobbling: Her FATHER collapsing in a COAL MINE. Limbs falling off Katniss's body in the Town Square. Prim collecting them i cart alongside berries she's gathered. Then those ANTS bore into our eyes, and Katniss passes ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She awakens where she fell, beside the pool, surprised to find that she's been COVERED by her sleeping bag. She bli A familiar face looks down at her from a branch above. Ru She's smiling. Katniss smiles too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss and Rue share a branch twenty feet up. Rue pulls LEAVES from a fanny-pack. Starts chewing them.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: How many are still alive? Rue answers, but her mouth is full of leaves so it's garb

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Huh? Rue spits out the leaves, chewed now into a PASTE...

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: Ten. Including us. Let me see your neck. Katniss turns. Rue applies the wet paste to the Tracker- Jacker welt on Katniss's neck. Instant relief.

dialogues.speaker: RUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were smart to pull the stingers out. If ya don't, you die. Rue puts the paste on Katniss's knee. More relief.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: There are Tracker-Jacker nests all over my District, so we always take these leaves with us when we work in the orchards. Rue now notices the horrible burn on Katniss's leg.

dialogues.speaker: RUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh. I don't have anything for that.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I'll be okay. Are you hungry? Rue nods. Katniss reaches in her bag, pulls out the RABBI she'd half-finished. Hands it to Rue - whose eyes go wide

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: For me? Katniss nods. Rue tentatively accepts the rabbit... Takes bite. Katniss watches her affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: RUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I never had a whole leg before.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I thought people from Eleven always had plenty to eat, since you grow everything there.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: Oh, we're not allowed to eat the crops. They're for the Capitol. If you're caught you get whipped. Sometimes worse. That lands. Rue spots the SUNGLASSES in Katniss's backpac

dialogues.speaker: RUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I try?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Those? They're useless. Can't see anything through ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: They're for night. (that threw Katniss) Night-vision. We use 'em in the orchards after sundown. Katniss pauses, chagrinned. Then pulls out the glasses, s them on. Sure enough: NIGHT-VISION. Green, but clear...

dialogues.speaker: RUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Careers have 'em too. They have all the stuff from the Cornucopia. In a camp by the lake.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: How many of them?

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: Cato, Clove, Marvel - and the Boy from 3, he guards the supplies.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: What about the Boy from my District? Peeta? Was he with them? Rue shakes her head. Katniss nods, pleased. Rue sags a bi

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid, Rue. We can beat these guys.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: s How? You can't run on that. She looks to that seared calf. Katniss tightens, irritate

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: It‘s fine. (Rue's unconvinced) They don't know how to be hungry like we do. They don't know how to forage.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: They don't have to. They have everything.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: We're gonna fix that tomorrow - and take all their stuff. After that, they're ours.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: And then what? That one hovers, unanswered. Katniss is silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seneca is alone, looking down from his SPACIOUS SUITE at Games Center below. Then, oddly:

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Hello, Haymitch. Are you lost? Reveal Haymitch, on the other side of a glass door. Senec crosses to the door - but doesn't open it, leaving Haymit in the hall, a spotless ELEVATOR LOBBY behind him.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Let me help her, Seneca. That leg is getting worse. (Seneca's silent) People like her. She's good theatre.

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Thanks for the insight. That fast, the elevator opens, and TWO PEACEKEEPERS emerg

dialogues.speaker: SENECA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Great to see you, as always.  82. e HAYMITCH She deserves better, damn it! People are starting to see that!

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Go, before the Capitol gets itself another Avox. Peacekeepers grab Haymitch, yanking him into the elevator

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: If you're gonna put on a circus, at least make it a good one... That lands. The doors close. Irritated, Seneca moves to a desk, hits a button - messaging the Games Center below. Betto looks up. No one else can hear them: *

dialogues.speaker: BETTO, (THRU HEADSET)
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: SENECA, (INTO COMM-UNIT)
dialogues.text: Where are we on the muttations?

dialogues.speaker: BETTO
dialogues.text: At last count, ten of them had been successfully modified, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: I didn't ask where we are on ten of them. I asked where we are on all of them. He pounds a button, ending the communication...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss and Rue share the sleeping bag. Stillness.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: I like your pin.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Oh. My father loved mockingjays.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: Me too. Sometimes I sing, and they spread it around the whole orchard. They carry messages for me. ° She sings four lovely notes, like a bird. Katniss smile  83. ++.until we hear a SOUND above them - FLUP! - followed by A tiny silver PARACHUTE, descending from on high - bearin BOX. It lands right on Katniss's lap. She looks to Rue.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Could be for you.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Open it. Katniss does. Inside, a JAR - of BURN BALM! Katniss yelps

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Thank you, Haymitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haymitch almost allows himself a moment of pride...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: "Day Four." Katniss's calf, remarkably, has almost fully healed overnight. She and Rue pack carefully.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: The Boy from 3 will be standing guard. He's not very big, but he's always armed. (Katniss nods, unafraid) What'1ll you do with the food?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Burn it. Dump it in the lake. Eat it! (Rue giggles) Don't worry. I'll think of something. Destroying things is a lot easier than making them. You remember where the fires go? (Rue nods) We'll meet by our tree, where the nest was. Take the sleeping bag - in case I can't get back by night.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: Okay. You know the whistle? (Katniss nods) If you hear the mockingjays sing it, it means I'm okay, only I can't get back yet.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I'll see you at dinner. Dress casual.  84.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: You be careful.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: You too, little duck. A surprising HUG. Then they take off in opposite directio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss emerges from behind brush - scouting, listening f unseen threats, her bow taut and ready. There's her targe Four Careers, camped 100 yards from the Cornucopia... Cato, Clove, Marvel - surly and covered in welts - and th BOY FROM 3. Their SUPPLIES are stacked in a PYRAMID: crat plastic bins, a burlap sack, all covered by mesh netting. Katniss takes it in, eyes darting... then:

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Look! He's pointing at something. The others turn... SMOKE, rising in the distance. Katniss grins, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rue fans FLAMES in a fire, sending smoke. Then she runs o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Careers arm themselves quickly. Cato in charge:

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Everything rigged?

dialogues.speaker: BOY FROM 3
dialogues.text: We're rigged. The Boy From 3 arms himself as well. Then the four of the set out in pursuit of that smoke... Silence - a long beat - Katniss waiting to be absolutely certain they're out of range... Takes a first step. Then she STOPS, abruptly. Just heard something: a rustlin ..-as another Tribute emerges from nowhere, approaching t pyramid. It's FoxFace, the Girl from 5. Katniss watching  85. FoxFace nears the Pyramid, doing an odd little HOP from o spot to the next as if avoiding something. Then she's the She swipes some crackers from a crate at the Pyramid's ba and APPLES from the burlap sack, stuffed into her backpac Then she hops away like a sprite, just as daintily as bef avoiding certain spots... as if they were mined... Then she's gone. Katniss watches her vanish again, impres then studies the Pyramid -- that BURLAP SACK, hanging by rope. It has apples inside. She approaches quietly. Fifty yards away now, her position slightly exposed. She grabs THREE ARROWS. Then, with blinding speed... Three STRIKES, in mere seconds. The first rips a hole in burlap sack. The second widens it. The third severs the r by which the bag was hanging. Now, apples _ spill out... And when they hit the ground... BOOM! LANDMINES - EXPLODI The blast blows Katniss backward, DISINTEGRATING the Pyra of supplies. She's mid-air, as: MORE EXPLOSIONS rock the forest. BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! Dizzyi thunderous. A shower of debris. Katniss lands hard on her back. The air splitting around her. But suddenly, she can't hear it. Blood pours from her lef ear, SOUNDS wobbling disorientingly. She tries to get to feet, but her balance is off. She staggers. MORE EXPLOSIO Shell-shock, feeding panic. She knows she has to run, but A FLASH, in the corner of her eye. She turns... The Caree are coming back! She drags herself away, hides... ...as the Careers return to see the damage. Cato's rage i instant: he grabs the Boy from 3, snaps his neck... Dead, just like that. The boy slumps to the Earth. A CANN goes off in the distance, but Katniss can hardly hear it. The Careers are arguing, trying to calm Cato down... then they set off in different directions, heavily armed, livi Katniss can't move. The world is wobbling. But she rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss stumbles - battered, bleeding, nearly deaf...  86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss taps the side of her head to make her ear functio No luck. She pours some water over it, washing blood away WHOOSHING sound that distorts things even further. Then, overhead, TWO MOCKINGJAYS land on a branch, eyeing strangely. They emit a SONG - a few notes - with an urgen to it. A warning maybe. But Katniss can't hear it. Then: She spots SMALL FOOTPRINTS in the ground - Rue's - just a SOUND pierces her deafness, horribly: A scream. From a child. Rue. God no. Katniss calls out:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Rue? No reply. She starts running, while drawing her bow...

dialogues.speaker: RUE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Katniss!

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I'm coming, Rue! Hang on! Racing, through the leaves of a low-hanging branch, to se Rue, on the ground, entangled in a net. And Marvel, five away, spear in hand, about to let it fly. He does so - just as Katniss fires an arrow at him. The two weapons pass one another in mid-air... Marvel is hit, in the throat. He drops instantly. But Kat can't celebrate... «»-because Rue's body is now curled around the spear. No.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no... Oh no... Rue... (head on a swivel) Are there more? Are there more? Rue shakes her head. Katniss pushes Marvel's body aside, kneels down, takes Rue's hand. A CANNON BLASTS.  87.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: Did you blow up their food?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Every bit of it. Just stay still. The spear is buried in Rue's belly. She can barely breath Katniss cuts the netting away.

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: You're gonna win. You have to.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Stay still. Rue tightens, her hands spasming. Katniss holds on tighte

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: Don't go, okay? Until...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I'm right here. Katniss moves in closer, trying NOT to look at the blood. But Rue's going to die. They both know it. Their eyes mee

dialogues.speaker: RUE
dialogues.text: Will you sing to me?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Sure. What do you-- Rue shrugs; it doesn't matter. Katniss nods, opens her mo But no sounds come out. Her throat's too tight with tears She gathers herself - just has to. Then she begins:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Deep in the Meadow/Under a willow/ A bed of grass/A soft green pillow/ Lay down your head/Close your sleepy eyes/When they open again/The Sun will rise... Rue lets her eyes close. Katniss keeps singing:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here it's safe/Here it's warm/ Daisies guard you from every harm/ Dreams are sweet/They all come true/ Here is the place where I--  88. -.-.when she's interrupted, by a CANNON BLAST. God, no... She looks down. Rue is dead. Katniss just stares...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -.-love you. Silence. Then those MOCKINGJAYS trill sadly. Katniss pres her lips to Rue's temple, releases Rue's tiny hand. Then she looks up, wanting those unseen cameras above to her rage. It's hard to miss. She rises...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss marches along, bereft but resolved, searching for something... Then she sees it: a bank of wildflowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss decorates Rue's body with flowers, one stem at a time. Covering Rue's wound, wreathing her head, weaving petals through Rue's hair. A sad, loving farewell. +..until all we can see of Rue is her tiny face. Then Kat tenderly affixes that mockingjay pin on to Rue's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People from Katniss's District watch, weeping, as: Katniss stands, almost at attention - and gives Rue that SILENT SALUTE we've seen twice now: three fingers to the lips. While a mockingjay softly trills Rue's melody...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: ‘Bye, Rue. (through tears...) You're safe now. Good and safe... Then the people in this Square, unseen by Katniss, return gesture. Fingers to lips, the silent salute, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rue's home-town. Rural. THOUSANDS of FARMERS watch, beref They too return the SILENT SALUTE to Katniss. But a few clusters of people are smoldering. TEENS. We ca feel them drifting away from the Town Square...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss quietly collects the items from Rue's backpack: * sleeping bag, water skin, extra socks, slingshot, some fo And, from Marvel's backpack: knives, spearheads, flashlig leather pouch, med-kit, full water bottle, dried fruit. EXT. ARENA — CREEK - DUSK Katniss wanders, her guard down, too sad to be afraid. Th she stumbles onto something that makes her feel even wors Rue's_ signal fire, still smoking. Katniss sags, lost. Sh hears two GROOSLINGS on a branch above...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grooslings cook. Smoke wafts up. Katniss doesn't care Then another SILVER PARACHUTE drifts down, landing at her feet. She opens the box... to find a LOAF OF BREAD inside «»ewith a note: "From the People of District 11." Katniss can barely react at first. Too touched. She breat out a sad smile, then looks up to the sky:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: My thanks to the people of District Eleven. She leaves this clearing behind - as we RETURN TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people of Rue's District watch in silence... Until: * CRASH! The window of a GOVERNMENT BUILDING just got shatt by a thrown TRASH CAN. Every head turns. * CRASH! CRASH! Two more windows shatter on the other side the Square. Three spontaneous acts of dissent, right on t of one another. Three different groups. Then a fourth. CR PEACEKEEPERS start after them now. But the THOUSANDS of * FARMERS gathered here suddenly fan out, "accidentally" * getting in the way of the Peacekeepers. * So the Window-Shatterers can disperse and scatter, protec as the Square expands with humanity. It's a first blow...  90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seneca, monitoring the incident live, turns to Betto.

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Assemble the Gamesmakers. My office in five minutes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in her sleeping bag on a branch, alone. Up in the s the faces of the District 3 Boy, and Marvel... and Rue. Then the ever-present Capitol Seal... and the Anthem. We WITH KATNISS as it plays. Rage hardening her face... unti

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (0.S., OVERHEAD)
dialogues.text: Attention all Tributes! Templesmith. His voice booming out of thin air. Katniss g still. Even the river hushes...

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (0.S., CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Gamesmakers have instituted a rule change. From this point forward, if two Tributes from the same District are the last to survive, both will be declared victors of The Hunger Games! Good Luck! And may the odds be ever in your favor! And just like that, the voice is gone. Katniss blurts out without even meaning to:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Peeta!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale lies on a bunk - in the musty, stale air of the AVOX BARRACKS - 5,000 silenced souls around him. An everpresen just showed him Katniss, saying that name: Peeta... Gale swallows a reaction... as TINY FEET rumble past: A T YEAR-OLD BOY, chasing a GIRL through these barracks. The boy has fashioned a fake BOW-AND-ARROW from a stick a two knotted shoelaces, pretending to shoot at his quarry. Gale watches, touched. Saddened too. Then a HUGE NOISE, a The barrack doors burst open. FIVE PEACEKEEPERS, shouting

dialogues.speaker: PEACEKEEPERS
dialogues.text: Head count! Everybody up and in line! The Avoxes leap from their bunks, alarmed. Gale freezes..

dialogues.speaker: LEAD PEACEKEEPER
dialogues.text: Move! Move! Everybody up! Lavinia looks to Gale, "It's okay." But she's scared too, clearly. The Avoxes scramble into lines before their bunk standing at attention. Gale follows their example. +.. aS that Lead Peacekeeper looks down a long row of the

dialogues.speaker: LEAD PEACEKEEPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've had a report of an unauthorized inmate in these barracks. Anyone found harboring him will be punished!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale's eyes just went wide. Lavinia's too. Oh no... *

dialogues.speaker: LEAD PEACEKEEPER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sergeant!

dialogues.speaker: PEACEKEEPER SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Sir!

dialogues.speaker: LEAD PEACEKEEPER
dialogues.text: Open every mouth in here until you find one with a tongue in it. * That cues the PEACEKEEPERS to start down each row, swingi TASER STICKS at every single Avox. Each mouth shoots open be checked. It's brutal, dehumanizing. But effective. * And Gale knows what'll happen when the Peacekeepers reach him. Lavinia knows too. Now what? Gale tightens, awaiting inevitable test that is rapidly coming right at him... Then, a hand on his arm. He looks down. It's the Ten Year Boy With the Bow, gesturing, "Follow me." Gale follows. Hurrying - through rows of bunks, hidden by all the commotion, with the Peacekeepers not far behind, until: The Boy points to the floor beneath a random bunk. Huh? T Boy points again... until Gale looks beneath the bunk: There's a GRATE in the floor. Oh. Gale kneels down, lifts grate. A HOLE beneath it. He climbs in, replaces the grat -..just as Peacekeepers rumble past this bunk.  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gale's now in a SEWER DUCT. No idea where it leads. But h starts crawling through it, hurrying away from here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning. "Day Five." Katniss has lit a big FIRE. Lots of SMOKE. She leaves it behind, setting out in search of Pee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks through a stream - crouched, like a hunter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scouting, eating her bread... when she spots a canteen. Empty. She keeps going. Then stops. At her feet, a barely visible FOOTPRINT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kneels down, letting some SAND sift through her finge The sand falls into ANOTHER FOOTPRINT. She gets on her be blows the sand away, revealing a cleaner look at the prin It's pointing North. She follows... Moving quietly, until she sees a RED smudge on a boulder: Blood. She stops, draws her knife, eyes darting... But she doesn't see anything. So she starts moving again through leaves - cautiously, delicately - trying not to m a sound, wishing her hearing was working better... ..-when a VOICE pokes through, completely disembodied.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: I'm not dead. Katniss freezes. The voice seemed like it came from below feet. Yet there's nothing but leaves down there... Wrong. The leaves are moving. And they have a face. Peeta

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, ("VOICE", CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just buried. He lies on this forest floor - camouflaged beneath mud, leaves, and twigs. We just caught a blink of his eye...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Peeta! What're you doing down there?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Well, mornings I spend recovering from the Tracker-Jackers you dropped on my head. Afternoons and evenings I spend mostly bleeding to death. She kneels down, lifts his head out of the mud, pulls a w skin from her bag, puts it to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This mean you heard the announcement? (Katniss nods absently) I guess we're on the same team now.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Could that be real? Could we really make it out of here?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I'll believe it if you do. He sits up, wincing in pain.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Are you hurt? No reply. Then she sees it, something uneven about the contour of his mud-caked leg. He shrugs, won't explain. So she brushes away some of the gunk camouflaging him - u it's right there, gaping at us: A GASH, in his leg. Hidden by mud but deep. Very. Damn it

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Cato. When he found out I was trying to help you.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I can fix it, Peeta.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Oh, you've got a hospital handy?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: My mom was a healer once, remember? We saw all kinds of injuries from guys in the mines - just need to get you cleaned up so I can see how deep it goes. Can you walk?  94. Ce She grabs his hands and yanks him to his feet. Literal He staggers, utterly unable to bear his own weight. She catches him, their faces suddenly an inch apart...

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: And remember, we're madly in love. So any time you want to kiss me, feel free.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Thanks. Have you eaten?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: No. One soldier carrying another off the battlefield, to: EXT. WOODS - RIVER/RIVERBANK -— CONTINUING Katniss gets him to the RIVERBANK, props him up against a rock, spreads her PLASTIC SHEET on the ground beneath him

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: > This isn't smart. You shouldn't be ¢ out in the open like this. She fills her water-jug in the river, returns to his side starts searching for his JACKET-ZIPPER. Dried mud hides i

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Frosting. The last defense of the dying.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Nobody's dying. She unzips his jacket. Pulls it off him. Then his shirt - revealing TWO BURNS, and FOUR TRACKER-JACKER WELTS.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have underwear on, right?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Good. She undoes his belt. Awkward, for both of them - but oddl @ stimulating. Unbuttons his PANTS, pulls them down.  95.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: sit. He sits on the plastic sheet. She slides his pants off, washes them in the river - delaying the inevitable. Leave them to dry on a rock. Then returns. His leg wound is still covered in mud. She takes the wate jug, stands over him, hands him a thin STICK.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: How about that kiss?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: It helps to bite down on something. He puts the stick in his mouth. She nods, then empties th jug onto his wound. He seizes with pain... +.-because the gash in his leg goes down to the bone. We PUS, lots of it. Katniss recoils, then feigns calm:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Rue gave me some leaves that draw out infection. We just have to get you somewhere dry for a couple days. (Peeta doubts it...) And you have to eat something.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I tried. It just comes back up again.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: There are some dried pears in my bag. We'll try those. Up. She pulls him to his feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sober Haymitch watches. On his TV, he sees PEOPLE IN TH CAPITOL STREETS, cheering for Katniss and Peeta.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Good. Good! More coffee, Effie?

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Please. Effie's beside him. He pours her a cup...  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss labors to bear Peeta's weight as they inch their through the woods. He's trying to stomach some pear slice

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: (kidding) Can't you go any faster?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Shut up and eat your pears. He enjoyed that. But every step is sheer agony on that le

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's a cave a little farther up the river...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big CAVE, its mouth concealed. Katniss covers the floor with pine needles, then lays out her sleeping bag. Peeta looks through her backpack, assessing supplies.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: You need rest... She lowers him down - which puts her face mere inches fro his open wound. She cringes without meaning to.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Sorry. I know it's--

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: It's fine. I'm just, not a big fan of pus.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Ya know, for such a lethal person you're kind of squeamish.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Your fever's still up. And we have to get some more food in you.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I'm not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: It wasn't a request. ..-which is when she notices the TINY CAMERA, mounted up in a back corner of the cave. Peeta notices it too.  97. e ...so it's hard to tell if this is performance, or sinc

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Katniss, thanks for finding me.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Twelves have to stick together, right? She starts to rise. He grabs her hand - dead serious:

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Listen, if I don't make it--

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Sssshhh.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: But if I don't... Before he can finish, she drops down and kisses him. Her first kiss - shocking the hell out of both of them - it's just for the cameras; we're pretty sure. Then it end

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to die. I forbid it. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Okay. A brutal SHIVER shakes his body - that fever just racking him; it literally slams his mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Get some sleep.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I will. In a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haymitch is up, and out the door, leaving Effie behind.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Finally! Something I can use! @ Effie giggles, excited. Haymitch heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another SILVER PARACHUTE lies on the cave floor, having j delivered a pot of BROTH. Peeta eats from it, while Katni conceals the mouth of this cave with vines and branches. Peeta studies her - looking very much like a kid with a crush. She tears down the vines, dissatisfied.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Horrible.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Looked okay to me.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Might've fooled a deer or something - but not Cato. She starts to rebuild it again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cave-mouth has been concealed now. Katniss eyes Peeta asleep in the sleeping bag - then climbs in beside him. It's odd, being this close to him. Feeling him. She puts hand to his forehead - it's burning hot. His eyes open. And here we are, inches apart. He strokes stray hair from her forehead. It seems genuine, comfortin She wants it to go on, which surprises her. He smiles, nothing said. She lets her eyes close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The people of The Seam watch, rapt... But:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FEET, racing in panicked flight... It's Gale, running. Up ahead is a RAILYARD. A block behin him is a PEACEKEEPER TRANSPORT, bearing a SEARCHLIGHT. Ga bounds a fence, falls into the railyard, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An UNIDENTIFIED HAND passes MONEY to a RAILYARD WORKER... throws open the DOOR of a RAILCAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++-as Gale races across the railyard, jumping into that o car. The Railyard Worker shuts the door, runs away... mer seconds before the PEACEKEEPER SEARCHLIGHT lands on: Haymitch, an empty bottle in hand, pretending to be on a drunken stroll. (He just paid off the fleeing Railyard Gu Behind him is another SCREEN beaming The Games. So even n Haymitch is able to watch Katniss sleeping... as:

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: ("slurred speech") Evenin', Officers! TWO PEACEKEEPERS lean out of the transport, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOYED PEACEKEEPER
dialogues.text: Man, are you ever sober? They drive away. Haymitch pats the door of the car, twice

dialogues.speaker: WITH/INT. RAILCAR
dialogues.text: Gale, as grateful as he is relieved, returns the signal. train starts to pull away. Haymitch watches it go as he drifts out of the railyard..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Day Six." Katniss awakens ~ to find Peeta sitting agains cave wall, holding her bow and arrow. On guard.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: It's nice, seeing you sleep. You don't scowl as much.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: How long was I out?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's noon. He looks even sicker this morning. Feverish, shaky. Damn She sits up - eyeing his leg. And her stomach drops. His wound's gotten worse. Much worse. RED STREAKS spider across the skin. Blood Poisoning. No doubt in her mind.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No good, huh?  100.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: You'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I know what blood poisoning is, Katniss. That stopped her. She studies his leg, then tells a lie:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: We just have to outlast the others, that's all. The doctors in the Capitol will fix you up after we win. She's about to rise, but she stops herself - following so impulse she can't identify... and kisses his forehead. Gently, affectionately. It surprises them both. Then it e KATNISS (CONT’D) Sleep. I'll go get us some lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peeta awakens, to find a SPREAD before him: roots, berrie And Katniss standing guard at the mouth of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: How do you do that? How'd you set all that up without me hearing you?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I'm light-footed. She just felt a twinge of guilt. Shakes it off.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Sleeping helped. My leg feels better. Definitely on the mend. A lie. She knows that. The leg looks even worse. He shrug

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: You want me to stop worrying about you. I won't.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I want you to save yourself.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Can't do that, Peeta. I owe you. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Yeah I do. The first gift is always the toughest to repay. Ya know? That touched him. She takes his hand, as: Templesmith again. Overhead. The Voice of God:

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (0.S., OVERHEAD)
dialogues.text: Attention all Tributes! (Katniss waits...) You've all been invited to a feast! Come to the Cornucopia at sundown; waiting there will be items each of you needs desperately, in backpacks with your District numbers on them. Good Luck, and may the odds be ever in your favor. End of transmission. Katniss and Peeta eye one another.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: A feast. Of course. Whenever there's been a day or two without any deaths.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: There'll be medicine there.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. You're not risking your life for me.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Who said I was?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I know you want to.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Right. I'm gonna run into the middle of some free-for-all against Cato and Clove and Thresh. Give me some credit, okay?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: You're such a bad liar, Katniss. I don't know how you survived this long. Anger flushes her face. She looks right through him. 101.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: You can't stop me, Peeta.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: No. But I can crawl out of this cave and call your name at the top of my lungs until they trip over each other on their way to kill me. And I will. (a beat) I want you to survive all this, Katniss.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: We can both survive. He said it. I'm not gonna sit here and watch you di-- She stops just short of saying it. Die. He eyes her. She tightens, frustrated... And marches out of the cave. ++.just as ANOTHER SILVER PARACHUTE, bearing a BOX, gentl wafts down from the sky, landing at her feet. Her eyes li up; there must be medicine in there! Hope!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the box... There is indeed a VIAL inside. Blue LIQUID. But she twists it open, sniffs it... And grimaces, furious, eyeing the unseen camera above:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Dammit, Haymitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haymitch sighs heavily. Effie is beside him.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: Ignore it, Haymitch. She's lucky to have you.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: No she's not... Effie pats his hand. Haymitch appreciates it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VIAL is empty now. Katniss pockets it. .-.then starts feeding Peeta with a spoon - strawberries, mashed into a paste. He's too delirious with fever to not  103.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: It's good. What is it?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Strawberries. The Mayor's favorite.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Oh. They taste sweeter than-- Just then... a flash of recognition. And a semi-guilty lo in her eyes. Peeta pauses, catching on... Livid: He tries to spit out the paste. Katniss covers his mouth. And she waits... until his eyes start to hang droopily. Then he's OUT. She lays him down gently, even mumbles "So without meaning to. Then she covers him... and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss peeks out from behind a tree. Nine ARROWS in her quiver. NIGHT-VISION GOGGLES on. Through them we see HER The CORNUCOPIA, fifty yards away.
