Nothing moving... +.-euntil she hears TWO METALLIC CLICKS. Then a patch of round OPENS UP in front of e Cornucopia - something emerging from below on a PLATFORM... a TABLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four items on it: Two LARGE BACKPACKS marked "2" and "11" smaller backpack marked "5". And a POUCH marked "12." There's medicine in there. Katniss knows it... But she ca be the first to risk bursting from the woods to run for i She looks around. Where are the other Tributes? Then, a STARTER'S PISTOL FIRES. And before Katniss can bl FoxFace emerges from inside the Cornucopia itself, swipes "#5" bag, and vanishes into the woods again. In mere seco Katniss shakes her head, impressed. Stillness returns. No movement in the trees. She steels herself.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Okay, Peeta. Here we go... And she BOLTS, head up. Seen through the GREEN GLOW of he glasses, it's a scary trek - racing for:

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Running. Table's ten yards away —- when an awful PFFFFT s slices the air. Katniss turns, gets a green-glow glimpse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNIFE, hurled by CLOVE. Katniss gets a hand up, deflect the knife with her bow, turns, fires an ARROW. It hits Cl in the arm - as Katniss gets to the table. She slips that tiny #12-POUCH on to her wrist. Turns... This KNIFE comes too quickly to evade - whizzing through air, gashing her forehead. Katniss staggers, drops to a k Clove is running right at_us now - arm bleeding, eyes let A KNIFE IN EACH HAND. Katniss tries to draw back an arrow but there's no time. She's a goner. Clove, barrelling in- Then, shockingly, Clove is knocked sideways, on to her ba «.-by a rock the size of a volleyball, hurled from the darkness. Clove quivers on the ground - disoriented, bloo Katniss is almost as confused as Clove is. Who threw that Then Thresh emerges... to re-claim the rock he just threw He stands over Clove, lifts it into the air, and brings i down_on Clove's skull. Katniss watches, awed. CANNON BLAS Now Thresh comes at Katniss, stands over her. He seems hu from down here, his eyes dull. And she's dazed, helpless.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Do it fast. Okay, Thresh? ..-which is when Thresh shocks Katniss - and us - by calm Placing something into her palm: The mockingjay pin she'd buried with Rue. Katniss gasps.

dialogues.speaker: THRESH
dialogues.text: This makes us even. Understand? She nods, speechless. Thresh grabs the #11-backpack, turn .--and gets a DAGGER right in the chest. +-.from Cato, who is suddenly just a foot away. The look Thresh's face is pure shock. Cato digs in deeper. And here's Katniss, a witness to it all. Thresh wheezes:

dialogues.speaker: THRESH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go. (Katniss staggers) Go!  105. Katniss rises, runs, horrified - doesn't look back. ...as Thresh gamely pulls Cato to the ground, trying to g his hands around Cato's neck. It's a struggle between two athletes in the prime of their youth. But Thresh is bleeding out, and he knows it. Cato plunges dagger in deeper, the life draining from Thresh's eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss runs for her life - crying, forehead bleeding bad Another CANNON BLAST. Dear God. She just keeps running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss staggers in. Peeta's in a fever dream, mumbling. gets to his side, and opens the kit she just bled for. Inside: a hypodermic needle, syringe, gauze... She sticks the needle into his arm, pushes hard on the plunger, then sags down to the cave-floor, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Day Seven." She awakens - to a new world: Rain, thunder. forehead bandaged. And Peeta, healthy again - by her side .--but his eyes are red. As if he'd been crying recently. Katniss blinks, studying him in profile. (He doesn't know she's awake.) She can see that his leg looks healthier no and bandaged. So why's he so upset?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Peeta? Are you...? He buttons it up quickly. Turns, faces her.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: You can't do that, Katniss. You can't do that to me.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Your leg looks better. Is it okay?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I don't give a damn about my leg! You could've died out there! (she's at a loss) Do you understand? I would never let you die for me! Why did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eo KATNISS For me. That just blurted out - and it surprised him. Her too.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I did it for me. Just didn't want to be without you. Again, she's realizing it just as she's saying it...

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: You didn't? (she shakes her head) Why?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I don't know! ‘Cause you're Peeta Mellark, the Boy With the Bread. (fumbling...) You're the Boy With the Bread. And-- e Then she's silenced... by a whopper of a kiss. A real o It's soft, but urgent. And it lands, wobbling both of the When it ends, he pulls her close - whispering, so no one in the world can hear:

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I didn't do that because they're watching. I did it because I wanted to. Another kiss. Then he studies her. So do we... Something shifted. We can see it in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Since I was five. You always knew that, right?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I guess maybe I did wonder now and then how all those loaves kept getting burned by accident.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: e Ssshh. My mother's probably watching. Katniss breathes out a smile, touches his face.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've drawn you a million times.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I know. I've see-- She stops short. He's not sure why. Then, suddenly, the rain stops - as if a faucet had been turned off. The skies clear in an instant, the forest flo filling with sunshine. It feels jarring, ominous. And Katniss knows what it means - hence her dread.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no... (a beat) He's gonna drive us back to the lake now. Once it gets down to the Final Four, he always does something to get everyone together. Can you walk?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Kinda. Is that where we're going?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Not until we're stronger. Not until we've eaten. He nods. They rise, both wounded, helping each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Day Eight." They stand in what was a CREEK yesterday. DRAINED NOW, bone dry, despite the recent rain. Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss, bow in hand, walks a gentle incline of forest fl Peeta's hobbling, but trying to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble is, he's making noise. TWIGS SNAP beneath his fee with each step. She's trying to ignore it... but she can'

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: You've got to move more quietly.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Sorry. Am I scaring the game away?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: And telling Cato where we are, yeah.  108. ® He tries to walk lighter. No good. Katniss tightens, ir

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you take your boots off?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Here? She nods. He takes another step. More crackling. Damn.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Are you trying to get us killed?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Maybe we should split up for a while. (she stops, turns) You hunt. I'll stay here and find us some greens or something. Maybe set the table. Truth is, she loves that idea. But doesn't want to offend

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: It's only because your leg's hurt.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Give me a signal, so we can contact each other. Katniss does a TWO-NOTE WHISTLE.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: ‘kay? (he nods) Stay in the neighborhood - in case I get into trouble. He takes that pretty well. She hurries into the forest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's looking for prey, bow at the ready. ..-.but there's nothing out here. No game at all. The for is completely still. Hmmm... She gives the whistle-signal Peeta's reply echoes back. She plunges on... EXT. ROCKS —- LATER MORNING r ) Hunting, quietly. But once again, there's nothing out No animals. No movement at all...  109.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Damn it, Seneca... She whistles for Peeta, checking in. This time, nothing comes back. She whistles again. Again, nothing. She tries a third time. No reply. Something's wrong. She starts to run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss arrives... to find her PLASTIC SHEET splayed out a tablecloth. A pile of roots on it. And some BERRIES. Oh

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: (instant panic) Peeta? Peeta?! There’‘s a RUSTLING in the leaves behind her. She reflexi grabs her bow, turns, about to fire, when... Peeta emerges from behind a bush. Katniss jerks her bow u the last second, the fired arrow narrowly missing his hea He jumps back, flinging a handful of berries into the air

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: What the hell!?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I whistled! You didn’t whistle back!

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I was gathering lunch!

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: If two people agree on a signal, they stay in range. Because if one of them doesn’t answer, it means they’re in trouble, all right?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Okay! Sorry! Put that thing ina holster! I was just trying to help.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: (re: berries) By picking these?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: It's all I could find. What's--  110.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: They're poison, Dummy. Oh. Peeta tightens, humbled. Forest silence around them.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nightlock. Instantly fatal. Where'd you find them?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Behind a tree, up-river. She nods. He examines the berries on the plastic... throw

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait. Did you take any of them?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: No. Why?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: ‘Cause... I picked a lot more than-- Just then, a CANNON BLAST shakes the sky. And a HOVERCRAFT DESCENDS - fifty yards from here, its ar quickly gathering a dead body from behind a tree... FoxFace - her fingers DARK BLUE from the juice of those deadly berries. The hovercraft ascends...

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I'll throw them away.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Don't. Cato'll be coming for us now. * That caught Peeta. She puts them in the pouch on her belt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seneca, the Gamesmakers, the staff... watching, as:

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Three left now: Katniss and Peeta playing a waiting game, and Cato * lurking. With so little food left in The Arena, who'll weaken first? *

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Prepare the platform, Betto. * (just decided: ) * And sound the cannon again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ill. e What? Betto pauses, thinking he must've heard wrong. *

dialogues.speaker: BETTO
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: The cannon. Sound it.

dialogues.speaker: BETTO
dialogues.text: But... nobody else died.

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Do we want them back at the lake or don't we? (no reply from Betto) * Sound the cannon! And cut the audio feeds on Four and Eight. Betto is silent. They all are. *

dialogues.speaker: SENECA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you no sense of drama at all? We * are climaxing. (again, no reply...) * These Games end now. @ EXT. FOREST - DRY CREEKBED — SAME Katniss and Peeta, moving slowly. The forest is still.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: We're gonna win, Katniss.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: (half-kidding) We have to. The whole world wants to see us together!

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Oh, your parents'd probably love that. You and a girl from The Seam.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: But if we win, you wouldn't be a girl from The Seam. You'd be a girl from Victor's Village - with all your needs met for the rest of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Haymitch for my only neighbor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me? 112. A laugh, then BOOM! A cannon-blast bounces off the trees. They freeze in their tracks. Did we just imagine that? Bu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mile away, Cato freezes as well. Just heard the same th And he sees a HOVERCRAFT descending in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss and Peeta see the Hovercraft too - also in the distance. It's almost too much to believe.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Does that mean Cato-- She can't finish the sentence...

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Last night, did you see Thresh die?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I just saw the start of it. Then--

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Thresh must've wounded him.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: It's over. Cato's dead. We won. Impossible. Neither can believe it. Both silent.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: We won...? Peeta nods - and they both start RUNNING toward the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cato starts running too. MATCH CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Footsteps. Haymitch's. Also running - right at: lake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haymitch bursts in. Seneca turns. They all do. Betto cock inserts himself in Haymitch's path, until: * A forearm shiver and a sweep kick, lightning fast... and Haymitch, reclaiming some long-lost skills, has put Betto the floor. Silence. Seneca smiles, amused and impressed.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: You are lost, aren't you. (at two PEACEKEEPERS ) Show him to the nearest bar. Haymitch lunges at him. The Peacekeepers step in, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss and Peeta, giddy as Hell, rumble through tall gra We did it! And there it is, the LAKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then that fast, they come to a HALT, confused. No one's h There's the Cornucopia. There's the blown-up Pyramid. But where's the celebration? Katniss just stares, thrown.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Peeta? Something's off. Way off. He's silent.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where's Claudius Templesmith? And the Trumpets? Where're the cameras and all the Gamesmakers?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I don't know. A tentative step. The stillness feels deadly. Like a trap Then, suddenly, some MOCKINGJAYS START SHRIEKING. Katniss whips around to locate them. The shriek repeats: a high- pitched, frightened WARNING, aimed right at her. And she knows what it means. Oh, no...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: He's not dead, Peeta. He's not dead! The shrieking builds - deafening. Then a horrifying BLUR: +..as Cato bursts out of the trees. Running right at us. Sheer TERROR in his eyes, as if something were chasing hi something impossibly lethal. Katniss turns... And there they are -- racing at top speed -- A PACK OF TH The WILD DOGS. “MUTTATIONS." Murderous and huge. Cato blo right by us, unslowed by the Kevlar BODY ARMOR he's weari Katniss turns, runs for her life. Peeta too - hobbling. B of them following Cato as he gets to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's brass, with a sheer face ten feet tall. There are se on it to give Cato some purchase as he climbs. Katniss follows at full speed, LEAPING UP, grabbing a sea climbing the wall - desperately. Adrenaline rocketing... She gets there... onto its FLAT SURFACE - and she and Cat square off instantly - Cato drawing a sword, Katniss her But, incredibly, the LEAD MUTTATION bounds that ten-foot wall in a single bound, barrelling into Cato. As they battle, Katniss turns - to see Peeta, hobbling th way. The PACK gaining on him fast. Her eyes go wide. Peeta gets to the base of the Cornucopia, starts to climb MUTTATION #2 swipes at his legs with FOUR-INCH RAZOR CLAW Instant blood. Instant agony. Peeta howls. Katniss fires an arrow right into the throat of the beast falls back, dead.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Climb, Peeta! He's trying. But the other Muttations get to his heels, a Cato stabs the Lead Muttation. A death-blow. He shoves th Muttation away. It lands at Katniss's feet. She recoils, instantly. Just saw something horrifying: This Muttation has human eyes. Glimmer's eyes. Good God..  115.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (can barely say it) Glimmer... Then she's shaken out of her daze - by a very flat voice:

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: What's it gonna be, Girl on Fire? She turns... and gasps: Cato has yanked Peeta to safety, sort of. He's got the gu a_ vicious HEADLOCK, Peeta's legs hovering off the edge o Cornucopia - with TWENTY HOWLING MUTTATIONS BELOW. They ALL have human eyes. Tribute eyes. Eery as hell. Katniss draws her bow. Aims right at Cato's head. The noi from the Muttations is a disorienting din...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Let him go, Cato. Muttations baying. Peeta turning blue... Katniss can't fi that arrow or he'll fall.

dialogues.speaker: CATO
dialogues.text: Somebody's gotta lose. You know that. But just then, Peeta uses his fingers to make an X on the back of Cato's hand. Cato notices, but too late. The smil fades from his face just as Katniss takes dead aim, and:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: You're right. She lets it fly - an arrow aimed right at Cato's hand. Bullseye. Cato cries out, reflexively releasing Peeta, wh slams back against him. They might both go over, as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8,000 people. No one breathing. Prim crying from the tens Mrs. Everdeen grabs her hand. Peeta's Parents are rigid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every eye in Mission Control, transfixed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRAFFIC stands still. PEDESTRIANS stop in the middle of a INTERSECTION, watching on a huge SCREEN. Cinna among them  116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haymitch, eyes shut, just can't watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cato loses his footing on the slick surface. Katniss lung forward, grabs Peeta - as Cato falls into the beasts. Instant carnage - a human being, torn apart. Cato shrieks Katniss watching in horror as the Mutts simply maul him. eyes find Katniss - a desperate, dying request: Please. Out of mercy, and sportsmanship, She draws back an arrow, sends it right into his forehead. Death. A CANNON BLASTS. Safety. At last. The remaining Muttations try to scale th sheer wall - but none of them can do it. Peeta and Katnis embrace... It's over. We've won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JUBILATION. Citizens cheering. Cinna beaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Everdeen gasps with relief. Peeta's Parents too. But Prim can't quite celebrate yet. Sensing something off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seneca bears no expression at all. Just nods, coldly:

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Have Claudius make the announcement.

dialogues.speaker: BETTO
dialogues.text: (sick about it) Yes sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mutts howl harmlessly beneath Katniss and Peeta.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I want ice cream. Every day.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: In Victors' Village. I want ice cream delivered to my house. Every day. Until Prim can't eat it anymore. Peeta laughs. They both do. He takes her hand. Then: «+.an announcement from above:

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Greetings to the final contestants of the 74th Hunger Games. The earlier revision has been revoked. Closer examination of the rule book has revealed that only one winner may be allowed. Good luck, and may the odds be ever in your favor. And that's it. End of announcement. Katniss just stares. Peeta too. Neither can speak - all h suddenly vaccuumed out of their bodies. The Mockingjays are silent. No sound in the world except howling of the Muttations below, which seems deadly again

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: If you think about it, it's not that surprising.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: No. I guess I always knew it somehow.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. I did what I came here to do.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I wanted to see you survive. Now you're going to.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: How ya figure?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: It's just math, Katniss. He stands, shakily, grabs his knife. In mild disbelief sh draws her bow back.  118. © ..-only to watch him toss his knife into the lake. Spla

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you I wouldn't let these Games change me. And they won't. She's standing, bow drawn, deeply ashamed. She lowers it.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No. Do it. I want you to.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I can't. I won't.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Do it - before the mutts get me. I don't wanna die like that.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Then you shoot me!

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Katniss, you know that's impossible. And they have to have a winner. So... eo That sparked something in her, an idea. But he goes on

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do it. So I won't have to.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: .-.What if they don't?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: What if they don't have a winner? People would go crazy, wouldn't they? (Peeta's silent) I don't wanna die, Peeta. But I know I can't kill you. Can you kill me?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: So... Peeta doesn't get it - until she unzips that pouch around e@ waist and extracts a couple of those berries. NIGHTLOC  119.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They only hurt for a second. Then it'll be over. All of this... She drops a few into his palm, keeps a few for herself.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Trust me. Mutual suicide, on live tv. But Peeta still hasn't agreed

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On the count of three?

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Hold them out. I want everyone to see. Two hands, extended. The berries twinkle.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Count of three. He kisses her goodbye, gently. They stand back to back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seneca, blood now draining from his face. Betto gasping..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8,000 stunned viewers. Prim, Mrs. Everdeen. Peeta's Paren

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands of GAMBLERS, eyes wide. Numbers flying across t electronic wager-boards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinna, and half the Capitol, breathless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lavinia, and the Ten Year-Old Boy, and every Avox down he watching without words. Despair on every face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sound. Haymitch turns: * Effie just burst in. Their eyes lock, pure dread... *  120. e EXT. ARENA - CORNUCOPIA - RESUMING The kiss ends. Katniss looks up...

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: ‘Bye, Prim. ‘Bye, Mom...

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid. I love you, Katniss.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: ‘Bye, Peeta. One... (steeling herself) Two... (Peeta nods...) Three! They shove the berries into their mouths... but -- TRUMPETS BLARE. And a FRANTIC VOICE booms from above:

dialogues.speaker: TEMPLESMITH, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop! Ladies and Gentlemen, I give you the winners of the 74th Hunger Games! From District Twelve, @ Katniss Everdeen and Peeta Mellark! FIREWORKS ERUPT, that fast, lighting the lake. CANNONS thunder. CAMERAS SUDDENLY DESCEND on Katniss and Peeta. The ground beneath the Cornucopia opens up, swallowing th Muttations. The Mockingjays sing. Now it's over. Katniss and Peeta spit out the berries, shocked and thril

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: You're not dead?!

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I'm not dead!

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: I'm not either! She throws her head back, laughing. They hug. We did it! grabs her hand, pulls her into the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss's NEIGHBORS - 8,000 of them - cheering, crying. E Corrina, who lost her son to The Games last year, is able @ smile now, through tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Everdeen and Peeta's parents cry with relief and joy This time, Prim gives into it as well, so happy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss and Peeta rinse out their mouths; then they're splashing each other, hugging.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I'm coming home, Prim! I'm coming home! Laughing, splashing - utter joy and disbelief - until: WHOOSH. TWO HOVERCRAFTS suddenly appear overhead. A SPLAS TEAM dives out of one, landing in front of us.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: What're they-- In seconds they've got him secured to a floating gurney.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Peeta? Before Peeta can reply, SPLASH TEAM LEADER signals the Hovercraft, and Peeta is whisked into the sky - gone - as SECOND SPLASH TEAM now zeroes in on Katniss. It's a blur. Then she's on a GURNEY too. What is all this???

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Peeta?! Just like that, she's whisked up. We CUT TO: ..-train wheels, flying down a track. We are:

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Days later. Katniss sits in a DINING CAR. Decompressing. She looks like a girl again - but sobered, changed foreve Staring out a window at the bleakness outside. We MOVE IN her, as a MEMORY hits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YESTERDAY: we watch from BACKSTAGE as Peeta is interviewe Caesar Flickerman before a packed house. Big APPLAUSE. REVERSE TO: Katniss, in a simple dress, watching from beh a curtain. In moments, she'll be called out to join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But first, Haymitch approaches her, and leans in:

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: (quiet, out of nowhere) Listen to me. You're in danger...

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING, (PRESENT)
dialogues.text: Katniss, reliving the moment. Then BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haymitch goes on, a quiet warning:

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: The Capitol's furious about what you did in the Arena. The berries. It smacked of "rebellion." More O.S. APPLAUSE from that crowd - Peeta charming them.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here's what you say: you were so Madly in love you couldn't think straight. Understand? (Katniss is a blank) Understand?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: Did you tell Peeta this?

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: I didn't have to. He's already there. Huh? But just then, Flickerman calls out from the stage:

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: How ‘bout if we hear from Katniss herself? Would you like that, Folks? HUGE CHEER from the crowd. Katniss steps on stage as:

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING, (PRESENT)
dialogues.text: Katniss, remembering... Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katniss shares a red love-seat with Peeta, her head on hi shoulder, her feet tucked under her - opposite Flickerman -.-as she and the audience watch HIGHLIGHTS FROM THE GAME  123. The opening Bloodbath, the fire, the Tracker-Jackers, the landmines, Rue's death, finding Peeta, those kisses... It ends with a shot of Katniss and Peeta, in triumph. Then:

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: Katniss, we know when love first hit * Peeta - at the tender age of five! But during The Games we all felt we * were watching you fall in love with him! Is that what was happening?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I think so. The audience LAUGHS. Katniss reddens. Peeta holds her.

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, at first I tried not to think about my feelings, honestly - because it only made things worse. But at a certain point, everything changed.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: When was that?

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: When I realized there was a chance I could keep him. Applause. Katniss sees Haymitch off-stage, looking please And there's Cinna, in the front row, thrilled. With Effie beside him, her eyes full and wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .«-.as Flickerman goes for the drama:

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERMAN
dialogues.text: But that moment where you pulled out those berries. What was going through your mind then? Katniss flinches a bit. The CAMERAS MOVE IN CLOSER... ..-as Flickerman waits... Peeta too... and Haymitch watch from the wings... until:

dialogues.speaker: KATNISS
dialogues.text: I don't know. I guess I just... couldn't bear the thought of being without him. Perfect. Peeta takes her face tenderly, kisses her. The C sighs. Flickerman beams. Haymitch can breathe.

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING, (PRESENT)
dialogues.text: Katniss, going over every step of it again. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show's over. Katniss and Peeta leave the stage to great applause. Haymitch here to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Great job you two. Just keep it up until we're back home and the cameras are off; we should be okay. Then he's gone, shaking hands with Flickerman... leaving Katniss alone with Peeta - who suddenly looks lost.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: What'd he mean, "Keep it up?" (Katniss hesitates...) Katniss? She looks away. And Peeta sags, heartbroken. END FLASHBAC

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING, (PRESENT)
dialogues.text: Katniss sits, her face a mask again - as we REVEAL: Peeta, sitting directly across from her. A frost between now. He leans forward, adjusting something: His brand-new artificial leg. He slides a pant-leg over i as this train slows noiselessly. One row up, Effie rises.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: We're here. Katniss nods. The train stops. An odd silence hovers... a

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Seneca sits, Peacekeepers on either side of him. Opposite sits PANEM PRESIDENT EVANDER SNOW. Not happy.

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: Mister President, it was the largest viewership we ever had.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SNOW
dialogues.text: Yes. And look what they saw.

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: It was good theatre, Sir.  125.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SNOW
dialogues.text: It was dissent. And you allowed it. No reply. Snow nods at a PEACEKEEPER, who throws open a d Wait. We're 5,000 feet in the air - nothing below us but forest, the Cornucopia a dot in its center. Seneca gasps. ...and looks to President Snow, desperate. No, you wouldn But Snow is expressionless, which tells Seneca everything

dialogues.speaker: SENECA
dialogues.text: One little loaf of bread...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SNOW
dialogues.text: You aren't without options, Seneca. Seneca brightens... until Snow opens a small box... revea several of those same dark berries. Their purpose is clea Seneca eyes them, and sinks. The prospect sounds awful...

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SNOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So? Seneca just shakes his head. Snow nods, understanding. Th

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SNOW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good luck, Seneca. And may the odds be ever in your favor. With that, Seneca is hurled out the side of the hovercraf We hear his screams, the SOUND MATCHING To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CROWD CHEERS, 0.S., audible through the rear door of th train. Effie eyes her two Tributes.

dialogues.speaker: EFFIE
dialogues.text: I want to thank you both. It's been an honor serving with you. Katniss is silent. Peeta too. Haymitch approaches.

dialogues.speaker: HAYMITCH
dialogues.text: Ready? Katniss nods, overloaded. Peeta misreading it entirely.

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Sure. Just another performance, right? Then we're done.  126.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Peeta, you don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: PEETA
dialogues.text: Don't I? Katniss tightens - as Haymitch throws open the door... .«-»-and CHEERS flood in, from a waiting crowd of THOUSAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This station is PACKED with the CHEERING CITIZENS of Dist 12 - roaring, as CAMERA CREWS capture it all. Peeta and Katniss step on to the back platform of the tra like candidates doing a whistle-stop, waving. Peeta's Parents are here. And Corrina - everyone crying. Everdeen and Prim too, their eyes wet, cheering. Prim jumps onto the platform, tackling Katniss, crying. Katniss holds on tight, desperately grateful. Until she sees something familiar in the corner of her ey e Gale, anonymous amidst the crowd. Their eyes lock. And there it is on her face: affection, relief, guilt, dr all at once... Peeta grabs her, kisses her. The CROWD CHEERS again - des the confusion in her eyes. The CAMERAS PUSH IN on her... Gale just smiles a thin smile; Katniss has survived, that all that matters. We RETURN TO:

dialogues.speaker: RESUMING
dialogues.text: President Snow looks down at the Arena, sullied now.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD PEACEKEEPER
dialogues.text: Back to the Capitol, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENT SNOW
dialogues.text: No. (flatly) There's a threat out there that wants to be strangled it in its crib. (resolved...) e Take me to District Twelve. The hovercraft banks hard, disappearing from our view...  127.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kiss ends. Peeta waves to the crowd, no hint that he' dying inside. All eyes are on Katniss. It's a lot to bear She is 16 and torn. Surrounded, but utterly alone. Home, more lost than ever. And her fight has just begun. We...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GO TO BLACK - over which, a SUPER: "End of Book One". The FADE OUT...
